1 1/2008 Lists of candidates recommended by the Screening Committees for following 08 posts of Scientists Gr. IV (1) 2009-09-20 17:45:00 2009-08-25
2 AD/CSMCRI/2009/I-Rectt List of Candidates Shortlisted for Test/Interview on 23/02/2010 for Advertisement No. (AD/CSMCRI/2009/I-Rectt) at CSMCRI, Bhavnagar Please bring the hard copy of Bio-Data and other relevant testimonials (in original) at the time of test/interview. No TA/DA will be paid to attend the interview. 2010-02-28 09:00:00 2010-02-04 Result
3 1/2010 Advt. for the Post's of  Techinical Officers & Jr. Tech. Assistants. <p><strong>CSMCRI Invites Applications for the post's of Techinical Officers & Jr. Tech. Assistants.</storng></p> <br />
<p>CSMCRI is a National laboratory  under CSIR.  The Institute undertakes a  wide range of R&amp;D projects in marine chemicals, coordination chemistry,  catalytic transformations, membrane technology, renewable energy, marine  biotechnology, wasteland development and environmental monitoring. The  Institute provides a conducive environment for research and has excellent  infrastructure by way of sophisticated analytical instruments, modern  laboratories, pilot plants, library, LAN network and workshop.  <br />
  Applications are invited in the  prescribed form from talented and result-oriented Indian Nationals for the  following posts:</p> <!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.1//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml11/DTD/xhtml11.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<head>
<meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=utf-8" />
<title></title>
</head>

<body>
<p><strong><u>GENERAL CONDITIONS :</u></strong></p>
<p>1.         Age  limit is relaxable for SC/ST/OBC candidates and certain other categories as  notified by the Central Government from time to time. Relaxation in age for  other entitled categories shall be admissible as per the Govt. of India/CSIR rules.<br />
  2.         Relaxation in age limit up to <u>five  years </u>may be allowed to the Council / Government / Autonomous Bodies /  Public Sector employees in accordance with the instructions and orders issued  by the Government of India from time to time in this regard.</p>
<p>3.         Relaxation  in age limit, qualification and / or experience in case of exceptionally  meritorious candidates may be considered.   Higher initial pay may be considered for exceptionally meritorious and  deserving candidate.</p>
<p>4.         The cut-off date for determining the  age, qualification and experience of a candidate will be the last date of  receipt of applications.</p>
<p>5.         All  applications received will be screened and suitable number of candidates will  be short-listed for interview. Mere fulfillment of essential educational  qualifications &amp; experience does not entitle a candidate to be called for  interview. The decision of the Director, CSMCRI, in all matters relating to  eligibility, acceptance or rejection of applications, mode of selection etc.  will be final and binding on the candidates and no enquiry or correspondence  will be entertained in this regard from any candidate.</p>
<p>6.         Applications  from employees working in Government Departments/ Public Sector Undertakings  and Government Autonomous Bodies will be considered only if forwarded through  proper channel.<br />
  <br />
7.         The  prescribed application forms together with instructions may be obtained free of  cost from the Central Salt &amp; Marine Chemicals Research Institute, Gijubhai  Badheka Marg, Bhavnagar – 364 002 (Gujarat), by sending a requisition along  with a self-addressed duly stamped envelope [(worth Rs.10/-)(size 11&quot; X  5&quot;)] which should reach Section Officer(R&amp;A) Central Salt &amp; Marine  Chemicals Research Institute, Gijubhai Badheka Marg, Bhavnagar - 364 002 (Guj.)  on or before <strong><u>26.02.2010</u></strong>.   The application form can also be downloaded from the Institute web site: <a href="http://www.csmcri.org/">www.csmcri.org</a>.  Duly completed applications accompanied by attested copies of the  certificates/testimonials in support of age, educational Qualification,  experience, caste etc., along with a non- refundable fee of Rs.100/- (Scheduled  Caste / Scheduled Tribe / Physically Handicapped candidates &amp; regular  employees of CSIR are exempted from payment of application fee) in the form of  Demand Draft drawn in favour of the Director, CSMCRI, Bhavnagar payable at any  of the Nationalised Bank at Bhavnagar should reach the Controller of  Administration, Central Salt &amp; Marine Chemicals Research Institute,  Gijubhai Badheka Marg, Bhavnagar - 364 002 (Guj.) by <strong><u>26.03.2010.</u>  </strong>SC / ST / Physically Handicapped  candidates should enclose a copy of certificate on the prescribed proforma  issued by the competent authority in support of their claim along with  application form. Candidates should specifically note that the applications  received after the closing date for any reason whatsoever (such as envelopes  wrongly addressed delivered elsewhere, postal delay, etc.), will not be  entertained. No representation in this regard will be entertained.  </p>
<p>8.         Incomplete  applications will be summarily rejected.</p>
<p>9.         OBC candidates must enclose, with their  applications, a copy of OBC certificate in the prescribed Performa in terms of  Dept. of Per. &amp; Trg., O.M. No. 36033/28/94-Estt. (SCT), dated 23.11.1995  prescribed by the Government of India.<br />
  <br />
  10.       The selected candidates shall be required  to acquire the knowledge of Hindi during the period of probation, if not  already possessing the same.</p>
<p>11.       The period of experience in the requisite  discipline / area of work, wherever prescribed, shall be counted with effect  from the date of acquiring the prescribed minimum educational qualifications  required for the post.</p>
<p>12.       The service is pensionable based on defined  contribution under the “New Pension Scheme” for new entrants as made applicable  to Council employee’s w.e.f. 1.1.2004. However, persons selected from the Government Departments/ Public Sector  Undertakings and Government Autonomous Bodies having Pension Scheme  on the Government of India pattern will continue to be governed by the existing  Pension Scheme i.e. CCS (Pension) Rules, 1972.</p>
<p>13.       Applications for each post should be  submitted separately with separate application fee for each application.</p>
<p><strong>CANVASSING IN ANY FORM AND/OR BRINGING IN ANY INFLUENCE, POLITICAL OR  OTHERWISE, WILL BE TREATED AS A DISQUALIFICATION FOR THE POST AND SUCH  APPLICANTS WILL BE DISQUALIFIED</strong></p>
<p align="center"><strong>               INTERIM ENQUIRIES  WILL NOT BE ENTERTAINED.</strong></p>
<p><strong><u>Abbreviations:</u> SC: Scheduled Castes; ST: Scheduled Tribes; OBC: Other Backward Classes </strong></p>
</body>
</html> 2010-03-26 17:45:00 2010-02-06 Job Advt
4 MBE/SKM/01/2010/2901 List of Candidate, called for Interview Advertisement No. (MBE/SKM/01/2010/2901) for the post of Project Assistant Level-II, Date of Interview: 19.04.2010 at 09:30 AM 2010-04-19 17:00:00 2010-04-01 Result
5 2/2010 SPECIAL RECRUITMENT DRIVE FOR PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES Applications on plain paper, as per Annexure-I, are invited for the following posts from the eligible candidates: <body>
<p><strong><u>GENERAL CONDITIONS :</u></strong></p>
<p>
<p>1.   	Age limit is relaxable for SC/ST/OBC candidates and certain other categories as notified by the Central Government from time to time. Relaxation in age for other entitled categories shall be admissible as per Govt. of India/CSIR rules.</p>

<p>2.	The cut-off date for determining the age, qualification and experience of a candidate is  the last date for  receipt of applications.</p>

<p>3.	Applications from employees working in Government Departments, Public Sector Undertakings and Government funded Research Agencies will be considered only if forwarded through proper channel and with a clear certificate that the applicant will be relieved in case of selection within one month of receipt of offer of appointment.

<p>4.	Incomplete applications will be summarily rejected.

<p>5.	All applications received will be screened and suitable number of candidates will be short listed for interview. Mere fulfillment of essential educational qualifications & experience does not entitle a candidate to be called for test / interview. The decision of the Director,  CSMCRI, in all matters relating to eligibility, acceptance or rejection of applications, mode of selection etc. will be final and binding on the candidates and no enquiry or correspondence will be entertained in this regard from any candidate or his/her agency.

<p>6.	Applicants should send their applications in the prescribed Performa (Annexure-I), neatly typed on an A-4 size paper only. Application duly completed in all respects along with (a) Attested copies of testimonials and Experience certificates (b) Caste certificate [(in case of SC/ST/OBC) and (c) Disability certificate issued by a Medical Board duly constituted by Central or State Government in the appropriate Performa prescribed by the Government of India, must reach the Director, Central Salt & Marine Chemicals Research Institute, Gijubhai Badheka Marg, Bhavnagar-364 002 (Gujarat) on or before 7.5.2010.
                                                                                                                                            
<p>7.	OBC candidates must enclose with their applications a copy of OBC certificate in the prescribed Performa in terms of Dept. of Per. & Trg., O.M. No. 36033/28/94-Estt. (SCT), dated 23.11.1995 prescribed by the Government of India.
          
<p>8.	The selected candidates shall be required to acquire the knowledge of Hindi during the period of probation, if not already possessing the same.

<p>9.	The service is pensionable based on defined contribution under the “New Pension Scheme” as made applicable to Council employees w.e.f. 1.1.2004. However, persons selected from other Government Departments / Autonomous Bodies / Public Sector Undertakings / Central Universities having Pension Scheme on GoI pattern will continue to be governed by the existing Pension Scheme i.e. CCS (Pension) Rules, 1972.

<p>Candidates should specifically note that the applications received after the closing date for any reason whatsoever, such as envelopes wrongly addressed delivered elsewhere, postal delay, etc., will not be entertained. No representations in this regard will be entertained.  

<p>CANVASSING IN ANY FORM AND/OR BRINGING IN ANY INFLUENCE, POLITICAL OR OTHERWISE, WILL BE TREATED AS A DISQUALIFICATION FOR THE POST AND SUCH APPLICANTS WILL BE DISQUALIFIED
               INTERIM ENQUIRIES WILL NOT BE ENTERTAINED.

<p>Abbreviations: SC: Scheduled Castes; ST: Scheduled Tribes; OBC: Other Backward Classes
                         OA: One arm affected (Right or Left) OL: One leg affected (Right or Left) 2010-05-07 17:45:00 2010-04-15 Job Advt
6 3/2010 OPPORTUNITIES FOR BRIGHT & RESULT ORIENTED SCIENTISTS <p align="justify"><font size="2">CSMCRI is a National laboratory under CSIR.  The Institute undertakes a wide range of R&amp;D projects in marine chemicals, coordination chemistry, catalytic transformations, membrane separation, solar thermal applications, marine algae, stress tolerant plant, and stress genomics.  The Institute has excellent infrastructure by way of sophisticated analytical instruments, modern laboratories, pilot plants, library, local area network and workshop. </font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Applications are invited in the prescribed form from talented and result-oriented Indian Nationals for the following posts:</font></p> <p align="justify"><font size="2"> 1. The service is pensionable based on defined contribution under the &quot;New Pension Scheme&quot; as made applicable to Council employees  w.e.f. 1.1.2004. However, persons selected from other Government Departments / Autonomous Bodies / Public Sector Undertakings / Central Universities having Pension Scheme on GoI pattern will continue to be governed by the existing Pension Scheme i.e. CCS (Pension) Rules, 1972.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">2.  All Scientists are entitled for Career Advancement on the basis of Flexible Complementary Scheme of CSIR.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">3.  All Scientists in PB-3 with Grade Pay of Rs.6600/-, Rs.7600/- and PB-4 with Grade Pay of Rs.8700/- Rs.8900/- shall be given two additional increments after their normal pay fixation.  However, it shall not be treated as a part of pay.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">4.    The posts carry usual allowances as admissible to Central Government employees as made applicable to CSIR employees of the same pay and status stationed at this Institute.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">5.  All Scientists in Gr.IV(1), (2) &amp; (3) are eligible for Professional Update Allowance @ Rs.10,000/- per annum and    Scientist Gr. IV(4) &amp; (5) @ Rs.20,000 per annum. </font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">6.  The Director, CSMCRI, Bhavnagar reserves the right not to fill up any or all the posts, if he so decides.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">7. Relaxation in age limit will be allowed to Scheduled Caste / Scheduled Tribe / Other Backward Class / Physically Handicapped and other notified categories as per the Govt. of India orders applicable from time to time.  </font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">8.  The cut off date for determining the age, qualification &amp; experience of a candidate will be the last date for receipt of applications.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">9.   Relaxation in age limit up to <u>five years </u>may be allowed to the Council / Government / Autonomous Bodies / Public Sector employees in accordance with the instructions and order issued by the Government of India from time to time in this regard.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">10. Relaxation in age limit, qualification and / or experience in case of exceptionally meritorious candidates may be considered.  Higher initial pay may be considered for exceptionally meritorious and deserving candidates.</font><font size="2">                                             </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">11.  Mere fulfillment of essential educational qualifications &amp; experience does not entitle a candidate to be called for Test and / or interview. The decision of the Director, CSMCRI, in all matters relating to eligibility, acceptance or rejection of applications, mode of selection, conduct of interview will be final and binding on the candidates and no enquiry or correspondence will be entertained in this connection from any candidate or his/her agency.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">12. Applications from employees working in Government Departments, Public Sector Undertakings and Government funded Research Agencies will be considered only if forwarded through proper channel and with a clear certificate that the applicant will be relieved in case of selection within one month of receipt of offer of appointment.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">13.  Applications for each post should be submitted separately with separate application fee for each application.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">14.   The period of experience in the requisite discipline / area of work, wherever prescribed, shall be counted with effect from the date of acquiring the prescribed minimum educational qualification required for the post.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">15.       Incomplete applications will not be entertained.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">The prescribed application forms together with instructions may be obtained free of cost from the Central Salt &amp; Marine Chemicals Research Institute, Gijubhai Badheka Marg, Bhavnagar – 364 002 (Gujarat), by sending  a requisition along with a self-addressed duly stamped envelope [(worth Rs.10/-)(size 11&quot; X 5&quot;)] which should reach the Section Officer (R&amp;A), Central Salt &amp; Marine Chemicals Research Institute, Gijubhai Badheka Marg, Bhavnagar – 364 021, Gujarat, on or before <strong><u>21-06-2010.</u> </strong>The application form can also be downloaded from the Institute's website: <u><a href="http://www.csmcri.org/">www.csmcri.org</a>.</u> Duly completed applications accompanied by attested copies of the certificates/testimonials in support of age, educational qualification, experience, caste etc., along with a non-refundable fee of Rs.100/- (Scheduled Caste / Scheduled Tribe / Physically Handicapped candidates &amp; regular employees of CSIR are exempted from payment of application fee) in the form of Demand Draft drawn in favour of the Director, CSMCRI on any Nationalised Bank payable at Bhavnagar must reach the Controller of Administration, Central Salt &amp; Marine Chemicals Research Institute, Gijubhai Badheka Marg, Bhavnagar - 364 021 (Guj.) on or before <strong><u>23.07.2010.</u>  </strong>SC / ST / Physically Handicapped candidates should enclose a copy of certificate on the prescribed proforma issued by the competent authority in support of their claim for exemption of fee along with application form.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">CANVASSING IN ANY FORM AND/OR BRINGING IN ANY INFLUENCE, POLITICAL OR OTHERWISE, WILL BE TREATED AS A DISQUALIFICATION FOR THE POST.</font></p> 2010-07-23 17:45:00 2010-05-22 Job Advt
7 4/2010 OPPORTUNITIES FOR BRIGHT & RESULT ORIENTED SCIENTISTS <p>CSMCRI is a National laboratory under CSIR.  The Institute undertakes a wide range of R&D projects in marine chemicals, coordination chemistry, catalytic transformations, membrane separation, solar thermal applications, marine algae, stress tolerant plant, and stress genomics.  The Institute has excellent infrastructure by way of sophisticated analytical instruments, modern laboratories, pilot plants, library, local area network and workshop.</p>
<p>Those who have applied earlier against the post numbers 4.1 and 4.2 of our advertisement No. 3/2010 need not apply afresh for the posts 1.1 and 1.2, respectively, if they are fulfilling the essential qualifications and experience as indicated against these posts.</p> <p>1. 	The service is pensionable based on defined contribution under the “New Pension Scheme” as made applicable to Council employees w.e.f. 1.1.2004. However, persons selected from other Government Departments / Autonomous Bodies / Public Sector Undertakings / Central Universities having Pension Scheme on GoI pattern will continue to be governed by the existing Pension Scheme i.e. CCS (Pension) Rules, 1972.</p>

<p>2.   	Scientists are entitled for Career Advancement on the basis of Flexible Complementary Scheme of CSIR.</p>

<p>3.  	Scientists in PB-3 with Grade Pay of Rs.6600/- are entitled for two additional increments after their normal pay fixation.  However, it shall not be treated as a part of pay.</p>

<p>4.    	The posts carry usual allowances as admissible to Central Government employees as made applicable to CSIR employees of the same pay and status stationed at this Institute.</p>

<p>5.     	Scientists in Gr.IV(2) are eligible for Professional Update Allowance @ Rs.10,000/- per annum.</p>

<p>6.  	The Director, CSMCRI, Bhavnagar reserves the right not to fill up any or all the posts, if he so decides.</p>

<p>7. 	Relaxation in age limit will be allowed to Scheduled Caste / Scheduled Tribe / Other Backward Class / Physically Handicapped and other notified categories as per the Govt. of India orders applicable from time to time.</p>  

<p>8.  	The cut off date for determining the age, qualification & experience of a candidate will be the last date for receipt of applications.</p>

<p>9.   	Relaxation in age limit up to five years may be allowed to the Council / Government / Autonomous Bodies / Public Sector employees in accordance with the instructions and orders issued by the Government of India from time to time in this regard.</p>

<p>10. 	Relaxation in age limit, qualification and / or experience in case of exceptionally meritorious candidates may be considered.  Higher initial pay may be considered for exceptionally meritorious and deserving candidates.</p>
                                             
<p>11.  	Mere fulfillment of essential educational qualifications & experience does not entitle a candidate to be called for Test and / or interview. The decision of the Director, CSMCRI, in all matters relating to eligibility, acceptance or rejection of applications, mode of selection, conduct of interview will be final and binding on the candidates and no enquiry or correspondence will be entertained in this connection from any candidate or his/her agency.</p>

<p>12. 	Applications from employees working in Government Departments, Public Sector Undertakings, Central Universities and Government funded Research Agencies will be considered only if forwarded through proper channel and with a clear certificate that the applicant will be relieved in case of selection within one month of receipt of offer of appointment.</p>

<p>13.  	Applications  should be submitted separately with separate application fee for each post.</p>

<p>14.   	The period of experience in the requisite discipline / area of work, wherever prescribed, shall be counted with effect from the date of acquiring the prescribed minimum educational qualification required for the post.</p>

<p>15.	Incomplete applications will not be entertained.</p>

<p>The prescribed application forms together with instructions may be obtained free of cost from the Central Salt & Marine Chemicals Research Institute, Gijubhai Badheka Marg, Bhavnagar – 364 002 (Gujarat), by sending  a requisition along with a self-addressed duly stamped envelope [(worth Rs.10/-)(size 11" X 5")] which should reach the Section Officer (R&A), Central Salt & Marine Chemicals Research Institute, Gijubhai Badheka Marg, Bhavnagar – 364 021, Gujarat, on or before 6.12.2010. The application form can also be downloaded from the Institute’s website: www.csmcri.org. Duly completed applications accompanied by attested copies of the certificates/testimonials in support of age, educational qualification, experience, caste etc., along with a non-refundable fee of Rs.100/- (Scheduled Caste / Scheduled Tribe / Physically Handicapped candidates & regular employees of CSIR are exempted from payment of application fee) in the form of Demand Draft drawn in favour of the Director, CSMCRI on any Nationalised Bank payable at Bhavnagar must reach the Controller of Administration, Central Salt & Marine Chemicals Research Institute, Gijubhai Badheka Marg, Bhavnagar - 364 021 (Guj.) on or before 3.1.2011. SC / ST / Physically Handicapped candidates should enclose a copy of certificate in the prescribed proforma issued by the competent authority in support of their claim for exemption of fee along with application form.</p>
 
<p>CANVASSING IN ANY FORM AND/OR BRINGING IN ANY INFLUENCE, POLITICAL OR OTHERWISE, WILL BE TREATED AS A DISQUALIFICATION FOR THE POST.</p> 2011-01-03 17:45:00 2010-11-11 Job Advt
8 1/2011 OPPORTUNITIES FOR BRIGHT & RESULT ORIENTED SCIENTISTS <p align="justify"><font size="2">CSMCRI is a National Laboratory under CSIR.  The Institute undertakes a wide range of R&D projects in marine chemicals, coordination chemistry, catalytic transformations, membrane separation, solar thermal applications, marine algae, stress tolerant plant, and stress genomics.  The Institute has excellent infrastructure by way of sophisticated analytical instruments, modern laboratories, pilot plants, library, local area network and workshop.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"><strong>Applications are invited in the prescribed form from talented and result-oriented Indian Nationals for the following posts:</strong></font></p> <p align="justify"><font size="2"> 1. 	The service is pensionable based on defined contribution under the “New Pension Scheme” as made applicable to Council employees w.e.f. 1.1.2004. However, persons selected from other Government Departments / Autonomous Bodies / Public Sector Undertakings / Central Universities having Pension Scheme on GoI pattern will continue to be governed by the existing Pension Scheme i.e. CCS (Pension) Rules, 1972.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"> 2.   	Scientists are entitled for Career Advancement on the basis of Flexible Complementary Scheme of CSIR.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"> 3.  	Scientists in PB-3 with Grade Pay of Rs.6600/- & Rs.8700/- are entitled for two additional increments after their normal pay fixation.  However, it shall not be treated as a part of pay.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"> 4.    	The posts carry usual allowances as admissible to Central Government employees as made applicable to CSIR employees of the same pay and status stationed at this Institute.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"> 5.   	Scientists in Gr.IV(2) & Gr. IV(4) are eligible for Professional Update Allowance @ Rs.10,000/- and Rs.20,000/- per annum, respectively.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"> 6.  	The Director, CSMCRI, Bhavnagar reserves the right not to fill up any or all the posts, if he so decides.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"> 7. 	Relaxation in age limit will be allowed to Scheduled Caste / Scheduled Tribe / Other Backward Class / Physically Handicapped and other notified categories as per the Govt. of India orders applicable from time to time. </font><font size="2"> </font></p> 
<p align="justify"><font size="2"> 8.  	The cut off date for determining the age, qualification & experience of a candidate will be the last date for receipt of applications.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"> 9.   	Relaxation in age limit up to five years may be allowed to the Council / Government / Autonomous Bodies / Public Sector employees in accordance with the instructions and orders issued by the Government of India from time to time in this regard.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"> 10. 	Relaxation in age limit, qualification and / or experience in case of exceptionally meritorious candidates may be considered.  Higher initial pay may be considered for exceptionally meritorious and deserving candidates.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>                                             
<p align="justify"><font size="2"> 11.  	Mere fulfillment of essential educational qualifications & experience does not entitle a candidate to be called for Test and / or interview. The decision of the Director, CSMCRI, in all matters relating to eligibility, acceptance or rejection of applications, mode of selection, conduct of interview will be final and binding on the candidates and no enquiry or correspondence will be entertained in this connection from any candidate or his/her agency.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"> 12. 	Applications from employees working in Government Departments, Public Sector Undertakings, Central Universities and Government funded Research Agencies will be considered only if forwarded through proper channel and with a clear certificate that the applicant will be relieved in case of selection within one month of receipt of offer of appointment.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"> 13.  	Applications should be submitted separately with separate application fee for each post.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"> 14.   	The period of experience in the requisite discipline / area of work, wherever prescribed, shall be counted with effect from the date of acquiring the prescribed minimum educational qualification required for the post.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"> 15.	Incomplete applications will not be entertained.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"> The prescribed application forms together with instructions may be obtained free of cost from the Central Salt & Marine Chemicals Research Institute, Gijubhai Badheka Marg, Bhavnagar – 364 002 (Gujarat), by sending a requisition along with a self-addressed duly stamped envelope [(worth Rs.10/-)(size 11" X 5")] which should reach the Section Officer (R&A), Central Salt & Marine Chemicals Research Institute, Gijubhai Badheka Marg, Bhavnagar – 364 021, Gujarat, on or before <strong><u>11.03.2011.</strong></u> The application form can also be downloaded from the Institute’s website: <u><a href="http://www.csmcri.org/">www.csmcri.org</a>.</u>. Duly completed applications accompanied by attested copies of the certificates/testimonials in support of age, educational qualification, experience, caste etc., along with a non-refundable fee of Rs.100/- (Scheduled Caste / Scheduled Tribe / Physically Handicapped candidates & regular employees of CSIR are exempted from payment of application fee) in the form of Demand Draft drawn in favour of the Director, CSMCRI on any Nationalized Bank payable at Bhavnagar must reach the Controller of Administration, Central Salt & Marine Chemicals Research Institute, Gijubhai Badheka Marg, Bhavnagar - 364 021 (Guj.) on or before <strong><u>11.04.2011.</strong></u> SC / ST / Physically Handicapped candidates should enclose a copy of certificate in the prescribed proforma issued by the competent authority in support of their claim for exemption of fee along with application form.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>

<p align="justify"><font size="2"> Abbreviations :- UR: Un-reserved; SC: Scheduled Caste; ST: Scheduled Tribe; OBC: Other Backward Classes.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
 
<p align="justify"><font size="2"> CANVASSING IN ANY FORM AND/OR BRINGING IN ANY INFLUENCE, POLITICAL OR OTHERWISE, WILL BE TREATED AS A DISQUALIFICATION FOR THE POST.</font><font size="2"> </font></p> Application_Form.doc 2011-04-11 17:45:00 2011-02-12 Job Advt

<p height="normal"> </p>
<p height="normal">Process Transfer</p>
<p height="normal">Ø   Technology transfer was successfully carried out for Non-chlorine route for epoxidation of styrene-to-styrene oxide using H<sub>2</sub>O<sub>2</sub> as oxidant to Eco-Organic Rampur, who are putting 1tdp plant on the process) (It is a green process where the catalytic reaction is conducted in absence of any organic solvent and the conversion to styrene epoxide is &gt; 99% with selectivity 98%).</p>
<p height="normal">Ø    Technology transfer to M/s Aquila Organics Mumbai:  Preparation of styrene oxide from styrene by hydrogen peroxide &amp; hydrogenation of styrene oxide to phenyl ethyl alcohol with 98% conversion and 98% selectivity.</p>
<p><strong> </strong></p> chiral catalysis development of chiral transition metal complexes as catalysts for various asymmetric organic transformations Yes

<P><STRONG>Field Experience:</STRONG></P>
<P>Domestic dearsenification plant installation&nbsp;<BR>(2005 ) in Maslandpur, 24Pgs, West Bengal, India from Central Salt and<BR>Marine Chemicals Research Institute, project funded by Ministry of Environment and Forests, India.&nbsp;&nbsp;<BR>&nbsp;</P>
<P>Domestic dearsenification plant installation&nbsp;<BR>(2006 ) and the regeneration of the previously installed plants in<BR>Maslandpur, 24Pgs, West Bengal, India from Central Salt and Marine Chemicals Research Institute, project funded by Ministry of Environment and Forests, India<BR></P>
<P>For the Aila Victims in Hindalganj, 24Pgs, West Bengal, India: To supply pure water from pond water through RO mobile plant from Central Salt and Marine Chemicals Research Institute (11<SUP>th</SUP> to 23<SUP>rd</SUP> June, 2009) . The pure water is filled up into jerry can (supplied by<BR>UNESCO) and supplied to different islands in the Sundarban, the mangrove Forest West Bengal, India).</P>

<P>The review entitled "<STRONG>Grafting: a versatile means to modify polymers Techniques, factors and applications</STRONG>" published in Progress in Polymer Science is one of the <STRONG>highest impact factor publications from CSIR labs in 2004.</STRONG></P>
<P>The abstract of the publication (<STRONG>Remediation of pesticides polluted waters through membranes Separation and Purification&nbsp;Reviews, 35 1-38 (2006))</STRONG> is in Abstracts in New Technologies and Engineering database from CSA.</P>
<P align=justify>Biographical Profile has been included in 2006-2007 Edition of Who's Who in Science and Engineering</P>
<P><BR>Biographical Profile is included in Outstanding Scientist of the 21<SUP>st</SUP> century, Inaugural edition published in 2007 by International Biographical Centre, Cambridge, England</P>

<p align="center"><strong>CURRICULUM VITAE</strong></p>
<h5 align="center">Arup Kumar Siddhanta</h5><p align="left"><strong>Date of Birth</strong>: March 30, 1954                                     <strong> </strong>                                         <strong>Present Position and Address</strong>:  Scientist-F;                 Group Leader – Natural Products Chemistry Group   Marine Biotechnology &amp; Ecology  Discipline                                                                  Central Salt &amp; Marine Chemicals Research Institute (CSMCRI)                                                                     Council of Scientific &amp; Industrial Research (CSIR) Bhavnagar 364 002, Gujarat, India.                      Phone:91-278-2567760 (Work);                         Mobile:91-9825189117;       Fax:91-278-2567562 (Work)</p>
<p align="left">E-mail: <a href="mailto:aks@csmcri.org">aks@csmcri.org</a>; <a href="mailto:siddhantaarupk@rediffmail.com">siddhantaarupk@rediffmail.com</a> ;                           Website: <a href="http://www.csmcri.org/">www.csmcri.org</a> </p>

<p><strong>Area of Specialisation :</strong> Organic Chemistry, Natural products chemistry; Bioactive compounds; Functional modification of seaweed polysaccharides; Polymers; Gels  </p>
<p><strong> Professional Experience:</strong></p>
<p>·        Visiting Scientist (DFG, Germany), Physical Chemistry I, University of Bayreuth, Bayreuth,</p>
<p>       Germany, 2003 (July-September) [with Professor Heinz Hoffmann].</p>

<p align="justify">University of Texas, Austin, Texas, U S A, 1984-85 [with Dr David E Thurston].</p>

<p align="justify">·        Research Fellow (UGC), Chemistry Dept., Calcutta University, Calcutta, 1975-78 [with Professor Avijit Banerji].</p>

<p align="left"><strong>Invited Talks: </strong>Delivered invited talks in India and Germany in Symposia and University                   Departments</p>
<p height="12pt"><strong>Ph.D. thesis examiner:</strong> Bhavnagar University, Madras University, Osmania University, Hyderabad; Calcutta University, Kolkata.</p>
<p align="justify"><strong>Reviewer: </strong>Review papers for various refereed journals including those of NISCOM, CSIR, New Delhi, Polymer journals of Wiley Interscience and Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH &amp; Co. KGaA; <em>Natural Product Communications</em>.</p>
<p align="justify"><strong>Ph D Students: </strong> <em>Five</em> received Ph D; <em>Two</em> registered for PhD degree; 7 Students are currently working for PhD degrees; One did MSc Dissertation, under my supervision.</p>
<p align="justify"><strong>Publications:</strong></p>
<p align="justify">·        Research Papers: 57; Published a number of papers in prestigious journals (<em>Acc Chem Res, J Org Chem, Tetrahedron Letters, Biophys Bichem Acta, Lipids, Org Magnetic Reson, Phytochemistry, Botanica Marina, Int J Biol Macromol, J  Phycology; J Applied Phycology; Polymer Journal (Japan); J Appl Polym Science; Polymer International, Food Hydrocolloids, Carbohydrate Polymers, Green Chemistry, J Polymer Materials, J Materials Science, Bioresource Technology, Indian J Exp Biol, Indian J Marine Sci, Separation Science and Technology; Indian J Chemistry A &amp; B; J Indian Chemical Soc) </em>in the areas of natural products chemistry of terrestrial plant, marine algae/seaweeds, animal (mammal),  functional modification of seaweed polysaccharides, hydrogels, enols and analytical chemistry.  </p>
<p align="justify">·        Patents – Co-inventor in four patents: One USP 6,893,479; dated  May 17, 2005; One US Patent  US Patent  No. US 7067568 B1; June 27, 2006;  One US Patent (US Patent Publication No. US 2005/0267296 A1) pregrant application published on December 1, 2005; one filed (September 2008).</p>
<p align="justify"><strong>Technology Transfers:   </strong></p>
<p align="justify">(i) One patented technology <em>&quot;Integrated method for production of carrageenan and liquid fertilizer from fresh seaweeds&quot;</em> (USP 6,893,479) transferred to M/s Pepsico India Holdings Ltd. during 2005-2006.</p>
<p align="justify">(ii)  The technology entitled &quot;Cultivation of <em>Gracilaria edulis</em> and Extraction of Agar Therefrom&quot; was transferred to M/s Community Enterprise Forum International, New Delhi, during 2006-2007.  This technology is based on our patent entitled &quot;<em>A cost-effective process for preparing agarose from </em><em>Gracilaria</em><em> spp.&quot;</em>(US 2005/0267296 A1; GB2429209).</p>
<p align="justify">(iii)   Demonstration of know how transfer for <em>Sargassum</em> based LSF on a 5 kg seaweeds batch  in the pilot plant (March 26-28, 2008).   The know how was transferred to M/s Jupiter Agriinputs Corporation, Vadodara.</p>

<p><strong>Dissertations Guided</strong></p>
<p><u>Ph D Dissertations</u></p>
<p align="justify" height="12pt">(i) Mr  M  Shanmugam  was awarded Ph.D. degree in Chemistry of Bhavnagar University in December 1998, for his thesis entitled <em>Studies on the Biomedically and Industrially Important Metabolites of Indian Marine Algae</em>, [Guide : Dr A K  Siddhanta].</p>
<p align="justify" height="12pt">(ii)  Mr A  Sai Krishna Murthy was awarded Ph D degree in Chemistry of Bhavnagar University in November 2000, for his thesis entitled <em>Chemical investigation of Indian marine algae with special reference to water soluble metabolites</em> [Guide : Dr A K  Siddhanta].</p>
<p align="justify" height="12pt">(iii) Mr A M  Goswami was awarded Ph D degree in Chemistry of Bhavnagar University in January 2001,  for his thesis entitled <em>Chemical studies on the metabolites of Indian marine algae</em> [Guide : Dr A K  Siddhanta].</p>
<p align="justify" height="12pt">(iv)             Mr Kamalesh Prasad, Scientist C, was  awarded Ph D degree in Chemistry of Bhavnagar University in December  2005,  for his thesis entitled <em>Chemical and Rheological Characterization of Seaweed Polysaccharides</em> [Guide: Dr A K Siddhanta].</p>

<p height="12pt"><em> </em></p>
<p align="center" height="12pt"><em><strong>Arup Kumar Siddhanta,  Ph.D.</strong></em></p>
<p align="justify" height="12pt"><strong>PUBLICATIONS</strong></p>
<p align="justify" height="12pt"><strong>Research Papers</strong></p>
<p align="justify" height="12pt">1.         Banerji,   A.;   Ray,   R.;   Siddhanta,   A.  and  Pal,  S., &quot;Constituents  of  <em>Piper</em>  s<em>ylvaticum</em> and  <em>Piper  aurantiacum</em>&quot;. <em> Indian J. Chem.</em> 17B: 538, 1979.</p>

<h4 align="center" height="150">Project Completed </h4><p align="justify" class="article_body" height="150"><strong><font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif">1)  Theoretical Investigations of Adsorption Additives onto the Crystal Surface of Sodium Chloride and on other alkali halides (<em>Funded by DST</em>) </font></strong></p>
<p align="justify" class="article_body" height="150"><strong><font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif">2)  Pores and Channels by Assembly of Cyclic Peptides: Design, Molecular Modeling and Synthesis (<em>Funded by DST/ Ministry of Education Zagreb, Croatia)</em></font></strong></p>
<p align="justify" class="article_body" height="150"><strong>3)</strong> <font face="Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif"><strong>Acetylcholinesterase (AChE) Inhibitors: the Neurotoxic Phosphotriesterase Substrates and Related Nerve Reagents- Conformation, Dynamics, Hydrolysis and the Therapeutic Pharmacophores. <em>(Funded by DAE-BRNS) </em></strong></font></p> Computational Chemistry/Molecular modeling: Ab initio, Molecular Mechanics, DFT, Monte-Carlo simulations, QM/MM methods--used to derive answers for problems in Organic, Inorganic and Biomoleular systems Our current research interests are: Designing new and novel Super Organic bases; Morphology of Ionic Solids; Novel sensors for anions, cations and neutral molecules; Ligand binding studies with DNA; Acetylcholinessterase (AChE): Conformations, Dynamics, Hydrolysis and the Therapeutic Pharmacophores; Structural-Activity relationships in Organic and Inorganic systems. Designing Pores and Channels by assembly of cyclic peptides. We do collaborate with experimental chemists to design and synthesize the molecules/systems of immediate interest. Yes

mso-fareast-language:EN-IN">Singh R.P and <strong>Reddy</strong> <strong>C</strong>.<strong>R</strong>.<strong>K</strong> (2016). </span><span lang="EN-US" style="font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
&quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;;mso-fareast-font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;;mso-bidi-font-family:
Mangal;mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:
HI">Unraveling the macroalgal-bacterial interactions through associated functional microbiomes. <em>Front</em>. <em>Microbiol</em>. 6:1488. doi: 10.3389/ <g class="gr_ gr_162 gr-alert gr_spell gr_disable_anim_appear ContextualSpelling ins-del multiReplace" id="162"><g class="gr_ gr_169 gr-alert gr_spell gr_run_anim ContextualSpelling ins-del multiReplace" id="169">fmicb</g></g>. 2015.01488. <br/></span></div></li>
  <li><div align="justify"><span lang="EN-US" style="mso-bidi-font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;">Baghel R.S, Trivedi N and <strong>Reddy</strong> <strong>CRK</strong> (2016). A simple process for recovery of a stream of products from marine macroalgal biomass</span><span lang="EN-US">. <em>Bioresour.</em> <em>Technol.</em></span><span lang="EN-US">203:160-165</span><span style="mso-bidi-font-family:&quot;Times New Roman&quot;;

</ol>

<p><strong>Ongoing Grant-in-Aid Projects</strong></p>












<ol>
  <li><div align="justify">Transnational approaches to resolving biological bottlenecks in <g class="gr_ gr_160 gr-alert gr_spell gr_disable_anim_appear ContextualSpelling" id="160"><g class="gr_ gr_168 gr-alert gr_spell gr_run_anim ContextualSpelling" id="168">macroalgal</g></g> biofuel production (SuBBSea). An international collaborative project funded by DBT, India and BBSRC, UK.</div></li>
  <li><div align="justify">Macroalgal biorefinery for CO<sub>2</sub> sequestration and production of biofuel and value-added compounds. A DSIR collaborative project</div></li>
</ol>

I. Kureshy, Hari  C. Bajaj, W. K. Jo *, <strong>Rajesh  J. Tayade*</strong>&rdquo; is published in book entitled &ldquo;Recent Advances in  Renewable Energy Research&rdquo; and it will be published as online volume of  &ldquo;Advanced Material Research&rdquo; by &lsquo;Trans Tech Publications Ltd, Switzerland.</li>
  <li>An invited  book chapter entitled as &ldquo;Photocatalysis: Present, past and future&rdquo; authored by  Thillai Sivakumar Natarajan and <strong>Rajesh  J. Tayade* </strong>is submitted for the  publication in the book entitled as &ldquo;Organic and Inorganic Pollutants in  Wastewater: Methods of Analysis, Removal and Treatment&rdquo; and edited by Dr.  Inamuddin, published by Materials Research Forum LLC. The USA</li>
  <li>An invited  book chapter entitle as &ldquo;Modeling and Optimization of Photocatalytic  Degradation Process of 4-Chlorophenol using Response Surface Methodology (RSM)  and Artificial Neural Network (ANN); authored by PS Patel, V Gandhi, MP Shah,  TS Natarajan, K Natarajan, RJ Tayade; is published in book entitled as  &ldquo;Photocatalytic Nanomaterials for Environmental Applications&rdquo;, 405-432,  published by Materials Research Forum LLC. The USA</li>
  <li>An invited  book chapter entitled as &ldquo;Enhanced Hydrogen Storage Properties of  Hydrothermally Synthesized TiO2 Nanotube-multiwall Carbon Nanotube  Nanocomposite&rdquo;; authored by Raj, M.C., Natarajan, T. S., Tayade, R. J., Bajaj,  H. C.; is published in book entitled as &ldquo;Photocatalytic Nanomaterials for  Environmental Applications&rdquo;, 258-274, published by Materials Research Forum  LLC. The USA</li>
  <li>Enhanced  Photocatalytic Activity of TiO2 Supported on Different Carbon  Allotropes for Degradation of Pharmaceutical Organic Compound; authored by RJ  Tayade, Jo, W. K.; is published in book entitled as &ldquo;Photocatalytic  Nanomaterials for Environmental Applications&rdquo;, 139-167, , published by  Materials Research Forum LLC. The USA</li>
</ol>

3 Analytical Services Analytical Services <h2>ANALYTICAL SERVICES</h2>
<p>Analytical Science division houses state-of-art Analytical instruments provides analysis comprising elemental analysis, chromatography, diffraction, microscopy and various spectroscopies i.e. wide range of sophisticated analytical instruments are available. </p>
<p>It consists of a blend of qualified, trained and experienced human resources as analyst. The division provides analytical services and intellectual input to both in-house and externally funded R & D projects of the institute. The division also provides analytical services and intellectual input to outside users as well comprising industries, academics (universities) and research institutes on payment basis. The facilities housed (see the list below) are one of the few unique one–roof place for availing such analytical services in Gujarat. We are involved in method development for various analytical need-based problems with sensitivity, accuracy and precision. There is discount in analysis charges for academics</p> 2 4 1 publish 2010-08-21 22:46:06 2010-09-03 13:20:26
4 Technology Technology 1 1 publish 2010-08-21 22:46:08 2010-08-30 14:27:46
5 Contact us Contact us 1 1 publish 2010-08-21 22:46:11 2010-08-30 14:27:51
6 Research Research 1 1 publish 2010-08-21 22:46:14 2010-08-30 14:27:57
7 News Knowledge Resource Centre (Library) <h2><span>KNOWLEDGE RESOURCE CENTRE (LIBRARY) </span></h2>
</br>
<p>The well equipped Knowledge Resource Centre (Library) at CSMCRI is a research-oriented library caters the scientific information support for the disciplines of Inorganic Chemicals and Catalysis, Membrane Science and Separation Technology, Bio-Salinity, Application of Non-conventional Energy Sources and Environmental Monitoring. Users are welcome to the library to borrow, to study, to read journals, magazines, books and electronic resources. It is open to the scientists, research scholars, masters students as well for corporate industries for browsing.  The library has been automated using Alice for Windows (AfW) – an international user- friendly library package. The software facilitates automated circulation (issue-return) of books and speedy access to bibliographic, location and availability information of the books in the library. Library has its own webpage. This facility is also available on INTRANET within CSMCRI Campus to benefit the scientists/research scholars by giving access to link at their respective fields.</p>
<p>The library has been  automated using Alice for Windows (AfW) – an international user- friendly  library package. The software facilitates automated circulation (issue-return)  of books and speedy access to bibliographic, location and availability  information of the books in the library. Library has its own webpage. This facility is also available on  INTRANET within CSMCRI Campus to benefit the scientists/research scholars by  giving access to link at their respective fields. <br />
<p>The library remains open on  all the working days of the year except on Government Holidays, Sundays.</p>
  <h3><span>Monday –  Friday:</span> 9:15 AM – 5:45 PM</h3><br />
  <h3><span>Saturdays:</span> 9:15 AM – 1:15 PM<h3><br />
<h2>Collection Development</h2>
<p>There are plenty of other materials in the library other than  books which include journals,  databases, CDs/DVDs, e-journals, reports, patents, conference proceedings,  training manuals, etc. Various useful databases  and other digital material perform an increasingly important role in the  library's reference services.
</p>
<h2>Databases</h2> 
<p>The library has acquired following  several databases. Web of Science is available provided through CSIR e-journal  consortia.</p>
</br>
<ul>
  <li>Chemical Abstract </li>
  <li>SciFinder</li>
  <li>Biological Abstract</li>
  <li>Cambridge Structural  Database</li>
  <li>Ullman Encyclopedia</li>
  <li>ASTM</li>
  <li>Delphion Patent search  (CSIR e-journal consortia)</li>
  <li>Derwent Innovation Index  (CSIR e-journal consortia)</li>
</ul>
<h2>Printed  and e-journals</h2>
<p>Library is subscribing 70 International and 70 National Journals. In  addition to it Library is also receiving&nbsp;various journals;as gratis. The  library is a member of CSIR NKRC e-journals Consortium which is providing access  to 3300 e-journals and some databases.</p> 1 4 1 publish 2010-08-21 22:46:16 2010-10-27 12:37:54

        <h2>&#2360;&#2361;&#2366;&#2351;&#2325; &#2325;&#2352;&#2381;&#2350;&#2330;&#2366;&#2352;&#2368;&#2327;&#2339; </h2>
        <p>&#2357;&#2376;&#2332;&#2381;&#2334;&#2366;&#2344;&#2367;&#2325;&#2379;&#2306; &#2340;&#2341;&#2366; &#2340;&#2325;&#2344;&#2368;&#2325;&#2368; &#2325;&#2352;&#2381;&#2350;&#2330;&#2366;&#2352;&#2368;&#2351;&#2379;&#2306; &#2325;&#2379; &#2348;&#2369;&#2344;&#2367;&#2351;&#2366;&#2342;&#2368; &#2360;&#2306;&#2352;&#2330;&#2344;&#2366; &#2340;&#2341;&#2366; &#2360;&#2375;&#2357;&#2366;&#2323;&#2306; &#2360;&#2306;&#2348;&#2306;&#2343;&#2368; &#2346;&#2352;&#2367;&#2330;&#2366;&#2354;&#2344; /&#2344;&#2367;&#2352;&#2381;&#2357;&#2366;&#2361; &#2342;&#2381;&#2348;&#2366;&#2352;&#2366; &#2360;&#2361;&#2366;&#2351; &#2325;&#2352;&#2344;&#2366;&#2404; </p>
        <h2>&#2346;&#2381;&#2352;&#2358;&#2366;&#2360;&#2344;&#2367;&#2325; &#2325;&#2352;&#2381;&#2350;&#2330;&#2366;&#2352;&#2368; </h2>

<p align="justify"><font size="2"><strong>3.        </strong><strong><u>DUE &amp; OPENING DATES</u></strong><strong>:</strong> The Offer/Quotations must reach at CSMCRI on or before <strong>29/01/2013 up to 5:00 P.M</strong> sharp<strong>.</strong><strong>  </strong>The tenders will be opened next day i.e. <strong>30/01/2013 </strong><strong>at 3:00 P.</strong>M. in the presence of bidders, who wish to present themselves at the time of opening of tender. In case opening date happens to be a holiday, the tender will be opened on next working day at the same time &amp; location. The price bids of two bid tender system shall be opened after technical evaluation of technical bids. The date of opening of price bids shall be informed to the bidders found suitable in technical evaluation. </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"><strong>4.        </strong><strong><u>EARNEST MONEY DEPOSIT (EMD):</u></strong> <strong>EMD for an amount NIL in the form of Bank guarantee or Term Deposit Receipt/FDR or Bank Draft of a scheduled bank pledged in the name of Director, Central Salt &amp; Marine Chemicals Research Institute, Bhavnagar valid for six months from the date of opening of the tender for the required amount as mentioned in the tender notice separate for each item must be submitted along with the quotation (with the technical bid in case of two-bid system and photocopy of the same enclosed with the price bid), otherwise quotation may not be considered.</strong> The firm registered with DGS&amp;D/NSIC as manufacturer for the supply of the same category of item for which the party is submitting quotation will be exempted from submission of EMD. Exempted parties will have to give proof of registration along with their quotation. EMD of the unsuccessful bidders shall be refunded at the earliest but latest within 15 days after finalization of the purchase of concerned item. The party must therefore, submit a pre-receipted Bill in triplicate along with the quotation (in case of EMD sent in form of Bank Draft, to enable us to refund their EMD. </font></p>

416 10-53(682)/81/12-13/PB 2013-01-08 2013-01-18 11:00:00 PRE INDENT CONFERENCE <p align="justify"><font size="2">CSIR-CSMCRI is interested in procurement of <strong>&quot;Dynamic Mechanical Analyzer, Differential Scanning Calorimetery, Thermal Gravimetric Analysis system&quot;</strong> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"> <em>Differential Scanning Calorimetery (DSC)</em> will be used to observe thermodynamic properties, fusion and crystallization as well as glass transition temperatures, oxidation and phase transitions.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"><em>Thermal Gravimetric Analysis system (TGA)</em> will be used to study vaporization, sublimation, absorption, adsorption, combustion, decomposition and desorption.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"><em>Dynamic Mechanical Analyzer (DMA)</em> will be used to characterize materials bulk frequency dependent properties of polymers such as modulus, compliance and damping. Stress-strain, creep recovery and thermo-mechanical and stress relaxation measurements.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Moreover applications include study of thermal properties of organic-inorganic metallic compounds, thermo-mechanical properties of synthetic and natural polymers and films, non-reinforced membranes and hollow fiber membranes.</font></p> <p align="justify"><font size="2"> In this regard, a pre-indent Conference is arranged as per details given below:</font><font size="2">  </font></p>
<p align="justify"><table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<tbody>
  <tr>
    <td valign="top" width="147"><p align="center"><strong><font size="2">DATE</font></strong></p>
</td>
    <td valign="top" width="106"><p align="center"><strong><font size="2">TIME</font></strong></p>
</td>
    <td valign="top" width="241"><p align="center"><strong><font size="2">VENUE</font></strong></p>
</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>

</td>
    <td valign="top" width="106"><p align="center"><strong><font size="2">11:00 am</font></strong></p>
</td>
    <td valign="top" width="241"><p align="center"><strong><font size="2">CSMCRI Bhavnagar</font></strong></p>
</td>
  </tr>
</tbody>
</table></p>

EMD of the unsuccessful bidders shall be refunded at the earliest but latest within 15 days after finalization of the purchase of concerned item. <p align="justify"><strong><font size="2">Section Officer (S &amp; P)</font></strong></p> pur_imp_724_12_13.pdf 2013-01-31 18:39:39

<p align="justify"><font size="2">2.                  The agency should have certificates of registration for EPF, ESI and Service Tax etc.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">3.                  The agency should have valid license under Contract Labour (Regulation and Abolition) Act,1970.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>

  <li align="justify"><div align="justify"><font size="2">EMD of Rs.20,000/-                                          <strong>of</strong> <strong>Director, CSMCRI, Bhavnagar</strong>.<strong>}</strong></font></div></li>

<P class=MsoBodyText2 style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt" align=justify><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt">1.<SPAN style="mso-tab-count: 1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN>The cut off date for determining the age, qualification &amp; experience of a candidate will be the last date of receipt of applications.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

The selected JRFs are allowed to register for Ph.D. Non NET/GATE qualified candidates may also be considered for Project Assistant (PA) if found suitable.</font></p> Rs. 12,000/-PM + HRA <p align="justify"><font size="2"><strong>The Discipline of Marine Biotechnology and Ecology</strong> of CSMCRI, Bhavnagar is actively engaged in multidisciplinary research in frontier areas of modern biology and biotechnology.  Some of the ongoing/new projects (sponsored by CSIR, DBT, DST, MoES etc) of the Discipline for which we wish to recruit 25 Junior Research Fellows and 6 Research Associates are:</font></p>
<ul type="disc">
  <li align="justify"><div align="justify"><font size="2">Cloning and characterization of stress-responsive genes and development of transgenic crop plants</font></div></li>
  <li><div align="justify"><font size="2">Climate change and adaptation- development of transgenic for salt/drought adaptation </font></div></li>

<p><strong>(1 Post PA-II) Microbiologist</strong><br />
  <strong>Salary:</strong> - Rs.  25000/- p.m. (fixed)<br />
  <strong>Essential qualifications-</strong><br />
  (1 Post) 55%  in M.Sc. in Microbiology.<br />
  <strong>Desirable:</strong> Candidates having  research experience will be preferred. <br />
  <strong>Job Requirement: </strong>Competence  in maintenance of microalgal cultures, microalgal cultivation, environmental  parameter analysis along with<strong> </strong>water  and<strong> </strong>Sediment analysis<strong>.  </strong> </p>
<p><strong>General  Conditions:</strong></p>
<p><strong>Age:</strong> Should  not be more than 30/35 years for PA-II/III, respectively on 4th  April&rsquo; 2019 (Relaxation as per CSIR rules).</p>
<p>CSMCRI is a  national research laboratory under CSIR, which is well equipped with research  facilities of international standards (website: www.csmcri.res.in).  Applications are invited from highly motivated individuals for the positions of  Project Assistant Level-I/II, to work in the area of microalgae under a project  funded by the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research, New Delhi.</p>
<p>Interested  candidates meeting the above requirements may attend the written test followed  by walk-in-interview with a copy of detailed biodata, original certificates  along with their attested photocopies and a passport size photograph on 4th  April&rsquo; 2019 at 9.30 A.M. at Central Salt &amp; Marine Chemicals Research  Institute, G B Marg, Bhavnagar-364002.   The selection of candidates will be done by conducting a screening test  followed by personal interview of the short listed candidates on the same  day.  No TA/DA will be paid for attending  the interview.<br />
  These posts are  purely temporary and co-terminus with the project.  It would, therefore, not confer any  right/claim implicit or explicit for any candidate for claiming extension or absorption  in CSMCRI/CSIR. </p> 2019-03-13 18:32:01

1 Home Welcome to our cms 1 1 publish 2010-08-21 22:45:55 2010-08-30 14:27:18
2 About us About us 5 1 publish 2010-08-21 22:46:03 2010-09-14 17:01:12
3 Analytical Services Analytical Services <h2><span>Analytical Services:</span> Testing &amp;  Analysis Service Offered</h2>
        <h4> About:</h4>
        <p> The state  of the art analytical instrument facilities available in the Central Salt &amp;  Marine Chemicals Research Institute (CSMCRI), Bhavnagar is part of the unique  infrastructure created over years to render analytical services and  intellectual input including analytical method development to a wide range of  users within the institute and also to the Universities, institutions and  industries on payment basis.        CSMCRI offers  analytical instruments facilities and analysis for Water, Sea Water, Brine,  Bittern, Salt, Mixed Salt, Clay, Minerals, Siliceous Chemicals, Seaweed,  Seaweed Chemicals etc to clients. </p>
        <h2>The clients  are categorised in four main categories as under: </h2>
        <ul>
          <li>Industry (large and medium scale)</li>
          <li>Industry (small scale)</li>
          <li>National &amp; State Govt.  R&amp;D Laboratories</li>
          <li>Students of Universities &amp; Educational  Institutes</li>
        </ul>
        <p><br />
          The  analysis charge is worked out based on the CSIR Guidelines for technology  transfer and utilization of knowledgebase considering various costs like  instrument cost, raw material cost, man power cost, overhead expenditure etc. </p>
        <p>The  details of instruments, analysis and charges for the same are given in the "Sophisticated Instrumental Facility" list below</p>
        <p>We  offer discount to clients as detailed below except Single Crystal X-Ray  Diffractometer analysis: </p>
        <table width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="15" cellspacing="0" id="contactT">
          <tr>
            <th>Sr. No.</th>
            <th>Type of Client</th>
            <th>Discount Offered</th>
            <th>Requirement to avail discount</th>
          </tr>
          <tr>
            <td>1</td>
            <td>Industry (large and medium scale)</td>
            <td>Nil</td>
            <td>Not Applicable</td>
          </tr>
          <tr>
            <td>2</td>
            <td>Industry (small scale)</td>
            <td>40%</td>
            <td>Copy of registration as small scale unit</td>
          </tr>
          <tr>
            <td>3</td>
            <td>National &amp; State Govt. R&amp;D Laboratories</td>
            <td>60%</td>
            <td rowspan="2">Samples should be submitted through proper channel ie. through Head of the Institute    / Head of the Department / PhD guide on official letter head in the format given at Annexure - II. </td>
          </tr>
          <tr>
            <td>4</td>
            <td>Students of Universities, Educational Institutes</td>
            <td>75%</td>
          </tr>
        </table>
        <p>Service  Tax and Education Cess as per government of India rule (at present 10.3% of the  total bill amount) is payable along with the analysis charge.</p>
        <h2> Mode of payment:</h2>
        <p> All the  payments including tax are to be made in advance by DD in favour of The  Director, CSMCRI, payable at Bhavnagar.</p>
        <h2> Address for submitting Samples  and Analysis Charge</h2>
        <p> The Head,  Business Development &amp; Information Management Discipline (BDIM), Central  Salt &amp; Marine Chemicals Research Institute (CSMCRI), Gijubhai Badheka Marg,  Bhavnagar-364 002.</p>
        <h2> General Information </h2>
        <p>CSMCRI  will not have any liability whatsoever arises out of using the analysis report. </p>
        <p>The  analysis charge once paid is not refundable but can be adjusted against future  analysis within next one year. </p>
        <p>For each  type of analysis, separately coded, labelled and properly packed sample in  sufficient quantity should be submitted.</p>
        <p> Clients  are not encouraged to remain present during the analysis, unless the nature of  the analysis is such that client&rsquo;s inputs are required during carrying out of  the analysis. In such cases a prior appointment must be fixed with the  concerned scientist. </p>
        <p>The number  of samples and type of analysis mentioned in the official letter will be  accepted and analyzed.&nbsp;Any further addition of samples or analysis will  require separate letter to avail the discounted charge.</p>
        <p> Analysis  report (soft / hard copy) will be given to the client. Please note that interpretation  of the result, conclusion based on result, certificate, recommendation etc will  not be provided with the routine analysis.</p>
        <p> Based on  the type of analytical work, intellectual inputs for interpretation of data or  development of analytical methods can be provided. For this service, prior  discussion with the concern scientist and payment of analysis charge is  necessary&nbsp;before starting the work.</p>
        <p> The  official money receipt and an invoice towards the payment of analysis charge  will be provided.</p>
        <p> The  sample left out after analysis will be destroyed routinely in CSMCRI.</p><br /> 2 4 1 publish 2010-08-21 22:46:06 2010-09-30 12:11:17
4 Technology Technology 1 1 publish 2010-08-21 22:46:08 2010-08-30 14:27:46
5 Contact us Contact us 1 1 publish 2010-08-21 22:46:11 2010-08-30 14:27:51
6 Research Research 1 1 publish 2010-08-21 22:46:14 2010-08-30 14:27:57
7 News Knowledge Resource Centre (Library) <div class="DynamicLayout"><h2><span>KNOWLEDGE RESOURCE CENTRE (LIBRARY) </span></h2>
</br>
<p>The well equipped Knowledge Resource Centre (Library) at CSMCRI is a research-oriented library caters the scientific information support for the disciplines of Inorganic Chemicals and Catalysis, Membrane Science and Separation Technology, Bio-Salinity, Application of Non-conventional Energy Sources and Environmental Monitoring. Users are welcome to the library to borrow, to study, to read journals, magazines, books and electronic resources. It is open to the scientists, research scholars, masters students as well for corporate industries for browsing.  <br />
  The library has been automated using Alice for Windows (AfW) – an international user- friendly library package. The software facilitates automated circulation (issue-return) of books and speedy access to bibliographic, location and availability information of the books in the library. Library has its own webpage. This facility is also available on INTRANET within CSMCRI Campus to benefit the scientists/research scholars by giving access to link at their respective fields.</p>
<p>&nbsp;</p>
        <div id="TabbedPanels1" class="TabbedPanels">
          <ul class="TabbedPanelsTabGroup">
            <li class="TabbedPanelsTab" tabindex="0">Services</li>
            <li class="TabbedPanelsTab" tabindex="0"> Timings</li>
<li class="TabbedPanelsTab" tabindex="0">Advisory Committee </li>
<li class="TabbedPanelsTab" tabindex="0">Resources</li>
            <li class="TabbedPanelsTab" tabindex="0">Union Catalogue of Serials</li>
            <li class="TabbedPanelsTab" tabindex="0">Institutional Repository</li>
          </ul>
          <div class="TabbedPanelsContentGroup">
            <div class="TabbedPanelsContent">
              <h3>OPAC (Online Public Access Catalogue) </h3>
              <p> As soon as new books are purchased and processed, their bibliographic description is added in the OPAC. Two terminals have been dedicated for the readers to use OPAC for their search of books. </p>
              <h3>Current Awareness Service</h3>
              <p>Users are constantly kept aware of the latest books added to the KRC through display of selected books and book jackets in the new arrival corner. Thematic displays are also organized on various occasions. 'New Books List' is sent to all the disciplines from time to time through e-mail. </p>
              <h3>Orientation Programmes</h3>
              <p>KRC Orientation Programme is arranged for the new scientists/staff in the beginning to familiarize them with various KRC services, sections of the KRC and their working. Training to use KRC portal is also provided to the new staff members.</p>
              <h3>Reference Services</h3>
              <p>At the KRC you can get personal help and guidance on information seeking. The staff can also guide you on using the KRC, databases and Internet services.</p>
              <h3>Other Services</h3>
              <p>Document Delivery - Articles/chapters required for research purposes only from the resources available at this KRC.  Ask A Librarian - At library@csmcri.org (For support, suggestion and comments) </p>
              <h3>Annual membership &amp; Borrowing facility</h3>
              <p>The borrowing membership is open to the corporate, students, academicians and researchers. This is based on annual membership subscription. The users are governed by normal rules and regulations concerning borrowing. When you receive a KRC card or when you accept being a guarantor you are committed to follow the user regulations and the potential changes of the regulations.</p>
              <p>All regular employees, project staff and student trainees are provided with membership facility. Membership Form<br />
                <br />
              </p>
              <table width="95%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="3">
                <tr>
                  <th width="33%">Category</th>
                  <th width="40%">No. of    &nbsp;books and periodicals that can be issued</th>
                  <th width="24%">Duration</th>
                </tr>

8 Right to Information Act Right to Information Act. ../RTI/RTI_Act.php 1 3 1 publish 2010-08-21 22:46:18 2010-08-30 21:43:05
9 Right to Information Act Particulars of organisation, functions and duties <h4>Functions :</h4>
<p>The vision of the institute is to be a highly creative, result-oriented, responsible and self-sustaining laboratory which synergies internal and external capabilities to :</p>
<ul>
	      <li> Constantly improve upon and popularize the knowledge and innovations required for optimum utilization of our coastal resources. </li>
	      <li>Anticipate opportunities and broaden the scope of associated technologies developed.</li>
	      <li> Address, wherever possible, specific needs of industries and organizations in the region and beyond.</li>
	    </ul>
<br />
<h4><a href="../../Files/rti/vmoo.pdf" target="_new">Vision, Mission, Objectives &amp; Organization Chart </a></h4> RTI_Act.php?pg_id=9 3 2 publish 2010-08-21 22:46:21 2018-07-25 18:40:22
