csmcri - tbl_tech:(48)
id,class_id,title,inventor,IPR_status,contact,introduction,process_features,tech_economics,tech_licencee,tech_status,category
1 1 Cost-effective process for production of ultrapure solar salt on large scale Patented,Field Tested,Demonstrated Salt and Marine Chemicals
2 1 Cost-effective process for recovery of low sodium salt from bittern R.N. Vohra US Patent No:  6,890,509 A new process for recovery of Low Sodium Salt from bittern has been described in the present invention, the said process comprising desulphatation of bittern (by-product of salt industry), evaporation of bittern in solar pans and processing of solid mixture with water to produce a mixture of sodium and potassium chlorides and optionally preparing "free flowing" and iodized, by known techniques. <h2>Advantages of the invention:</h2></br>
(i)	The ratio of KCl and NaCl can be adjusted in the range from 20% KCl to 70% KCl according to customer requirements by varying the baume density at which the carnallite crystallizer pan is charged. Ms/ Archean Group of Chemical Industries , Chennai Patented,Licensed Salt and Marine Chemicals
3 1 Device for remote monitoring of brine density in salt works P K Ghosh US Patent No:  6,865,942 The present invention relates to a novel device that enables a person to gauge the brine density in solar salt works from afar without recourse to sampling of the brine. The device--which can be considered as an improvisation over the conventional laboratory type Baume meter can be placed directly in the salt pan. The device remains sunk, and therefore invisible, until the desired density of brine is approached. Thereafter it gradually floats up and becomes visible from afar. From appropriate markings on the rod connected to the top end of the device, it can be gauged whether the brine is yet to attain the desired density, or has attained the desired density range, or has exceeded the desired density range. The device is resistant to corrosion and able to combat extreme weather conditions prevailing in solar salt works. The control of brine density from afar helps eliminate the need for frequent sampling of brine for density measurement that would make adherence to the optimum process of salt production easier. The methodology can be extended to production of other marine chemicals such as carnallite and kainite. <h2>Advantages of the invention:</h2></br>
The material of construction of the device is compatible with any brine of any concentration, and is tolerant to the corrosive property of brine and the large temperature variations in the solar salt works that are typically set up in semi-arid regions. The materials used for construction of the device are fiber reinforced plastic and stainless steel. The configuration of the device is so made as to minimize accumulation of salts that might alter the precision of the device. Units given to Gujarat Heavy Chemicals Ltd., for testing.  Units helped to
improve the quality of salt. Patented Salt and Marine Chemicals
4 1 (a) Preparation of highly stable iodizing agent; </br>
(b) cost-effective iodizing agents and their preparation P K Ghosh US Patent Application No: 12/086 542 The present invention is directed to provide a novel iodized salt that is iodized by- the mixture of iodide and iodate in 5:1 molar ratio is used for iodization of salt and is shown to be a source of latent elemental iodine that can be liberated from the salt under acidic conditions such as that which prevails in the stomach.  The iodizing agent is stabilized in the salt by adjusting pH to be in the range of 7.5-8.0.  The said iodizing agent may be prepared cost-effectively through the reaction of pure iodine crystals with a suitable alkali. <h2>Advantages of the invention:</h2>/br>
i.	Iodine in the form of more potent elemental iodine can be delivered in the stomach through the vehicle of salt. </br>
ii.	The iodizing agent of the present invention would be both easier and cheaper to produce than either of the conventional iodizing agents used hitherto for salt iodization, namely pure iodide or iodate salts.</br>
iii.	Delivery of iodine in the form of elemental iodine via the iodide-iodate system may lead to greater efficacy of treatment of iodine deficiency disorders. </br> Yet to be licensed Patented Salt and Marine Chemicals
5 1 Integrated process for the recovery of sulphate of potash and refractory grade magnesia from sea bittern P K Ghosh US Patent No:  7,041,268 The present invention is directed to a novel integrated process for the recovery of sulphate of potash (SOP) from sulphate rich bittern. The process requires bittern and lime as raw materials. Kainite type mixed salt is obtained by fractional crystallization of the bittern, and is converted to schoenite which is subsequently reacted with muriate of potash (MOP) for its conversion to SOP. End liquor from kainite to schoenite conversion (SEL) is desulphated and supplemented with MgCl<sub>2</sub>using end bittern generated in the process of making carnallite. Decomposed carnallite liquor produced is reacted with hydrated lime for preparing CaCl<sub>2</sub> solution and high purity Mg(OH)<sub>2</sub> having low boron content. It is shown that the liquid streams containing potash are recycled in the process, and the recovery of potash in the form of SOP is quantitative. <h2>Advantages of the invention:</h2></br>
	(i)	SOP is a dual fertilizer containing 50% K<sub>2</sub>O and 18% sulfur.</br>
	(ii)	SOP is virtually free of chloride and hence ideal for saline soils and chloride sensitive crops.</br>
	(iii)	SOP has lower salt index i.e low osmostic effect</br>
      Salt index of sodium nitrate  =  100</br>
      Muriate of potash (MOP)       =  116.3</br>
      Nitrate of potash (KNO<sub>3</sub>)       =  73.6</br>
      Sulphate of potash (SOP)       =  46.1</br> Ms/ Archean Group of Chemical Industries , Chennai Patented,Licensed Salt and Marine Chemicals
6 1 Process for the preparation of refractory grade magnesia of >97% purity and requiring less water in the process 12/400512 and 11/376707 The present invention provides an improved process for the preparation of MgO of high purity >99% from salt bitterns via intermediate formation of Mg(OH)<sub>2</sub> obtained from the reaction of MgCl<sub>2</sub> and lime, albeit indirectly, i.e., MgCl2 is first reacted with NH3 in aqueous medium and the slurry is then filtered with ease. The resultant NH<sub>4</sub>Cl-containing filtrate is then treated with any lime, to regenerate NH<sub>3</sub> while the lime itself gets transformed into CaCl<sub>2</sub> that is used for desulphatation of bittern so as to recover carnallite and thereafter MgCl<sub>2</sub>of desired quality required in the present invention. The crude Mg(OH)<sub>2</sub>is dried and calcined directly to produce pure MgO, taking advantage of the fact that adhering impurities in the Mg(OH)<sub>2</sub> either volatilize away or get transformed into the desired product, i.e., MgO. <h2>Advantages of the invention:</h2></br>
The main advantage invention is that Mg(OH)<sub>2</sub> obtained from the reaction of MgCl<sub>2</sub> and ammonia in aqueous medium, which is very easy to filter, requires no further purification and can directly yield MgO of high purity, thereby largely eliminating the tedious nature of work up encountered in the conventional process of preparation of MgO from purified Mg(OH)<sub>2</sub>. Yet to be licensed Patented Salt and Marine Chemicals
7 1 Pharma and halogen grade synthetic hydrotalcites (SHT) from bitterns P M Oza US Patent No:  7,022,302 An improved process is described for the preparation of surface modified hydrotalcite. The process comprises reacting a precursor of magnesium and aluminium in the presence of suitable alkali carbonate at high temperature. The product has a BET surface area of 20M<sup>2</sup>/gm and average particle size of 5 micorns and is useful as halogen scavenger and fire retardant. <h2>Advantages of the invention:</h2></br>
(i)	Cheap and easily available sea bittern and non-ferric alum has been used as a source of magnesium and aluminium compound respectively.</br>
(ii)	The mother liquor after crystallization can be reused. </br>
(iii)	The process does not require costly equipment for drying i.e. spray drier. </br>
(iv)	(iv)  Product having less surface area (20M<sup>2</sup>/gm) and fine particle size (average 5 microns) and at least 90% (by volume) particles are under 1 micron) and free from amorphous as well as crystalline impurities, can be obtained with less energy intensive step of 4 -5 hrs of heat crystallization at 140-150.degree. C. Yet to be licensed Patented Salt and Marine Chemicals
8 1 (a) Cost effective preparation of safe brominating reagent having high atom efficiency </br>
(b) Processes for preparation of several commercially important bromo derivatives and pharmaceutical intermediates utilizing the reagent G. Ramachandraiah US Patent No:  6,740,253 The present invention relates to a non-hazardous brominating reagent from an aqueous alkaline bromine byproduct solution obtained from bromine recovery plant and containing 25 to 35% bromine dissolved in aqueous lime or sodium hydroxide containing alkali bromide and alkali bromate mixture having bromide to bromate stoichiometric ratio in the range of 5:1 to 5.1:1 or 2:1 to 2.1:1 and a pH ranging between 8-12 and also relates to a method for borminating aromatic compounds by using the above brominating agent. <h2>Advantages of the invention:</h2></br>
(i)	Inexpensive method of preparation of non-hazardous brominating reagents that are stable under storage and can be formulated either in solution or solid forms. </br>
(ii)	The alkaline bromine mixture with 5:1 bromide: bromate is a substitute for liquid bromine in bromine addition reactions and can be used for aromatic bromination reactions. </br>
(iii)	The brominating reagent with 2:1 bromide: bromate can be prepared from the alkaline bromine mixture through oxidation with inexpensive oxidizing agents and is especially suitable for aromatic bromine reactions with high Br atom efficiency that avoids the formation of HBr.</br>
(iv)	The brominating reagents are activated by simple addition of mineral acid and no catalyst is required for the bromination reactions. </br>
(v)	Bromination reaction can be carried out with the present brominating reagents under ambient conditions. Ms/ Chemcon Specialty Chemical Pvt. Ltd, Vadodara Patented,Licensed Salt and Marine Chemicals
9 2 Eco-friendly non-chlorine process for preparation of styrene oxide Patented,Licensed
10 2 Solid acid-catalysed process for the preparation of isolongifolene from longifolene Marine Biotechnology and Ecology

csmcri - technology:(27)
ID,Title,Introduction,Process_Features,Tech_Economics,IPR_Status,Image_1,Image_2,Image_3
1 Preparations of nutrient rich Salt of plant origins <p align="justify"><span>Uncertainly of monsoon in many parts of the country has created drought like situation. Such uncertainties will remain in feature as well. Over exploitation of ground water for different uses, the water quality has deteriorated considerably and becoming increasingly more brakish. All of this has made it imperative to study crops with greater degree of salt tolerance. The plants are generally not tolerant to salt but there are certain plants occurring in nature that grows under high saline conditions. One such plant that has a great economic potential is <i>Salicornia brachiata</i>. Tender tips of <i>Salicornia</i> which are salty is taste have become popular as a salad is west. Seeds from the plant contain 25 – 35% oil which is rich in linolenic acid and closely resembles safflower oil. CSMCRI has developed agrotechnology for cultivations of the species and in the process germplasm was also improved for higher yield with recurrent selections. To make it <i>salicornia</i> cultivations economically more attractive besides oil and vegetable tips a process to produce vegetable salt from the waste biomass after removing the seeds for oil was developed. The demonstrations of cultivations potential and realization of two products from the plant instead of one offers opportunities to make large scale saline cultivation<span>&nbsp; </span>as an alternative possibility from the view point of eco restrictions and realizing value from the wastelands.</span></p> <P align=justify><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">The preparation of vegetable salt involves cultivations of <I>Salicornia</I> on highly saline soils, irrigations with seawater or highly saline bore well water, harvesting sundrying, separating seeds from the spikes, mixing the husk with remaing biomass and processing to obtain fine white crystalline and free flowing refined salt.</SPAN></P><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 150%; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B>Specifications of the product:<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></B></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 150%; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="mso-tab-count: 1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN>The vegetable salt is named as ‘Saloni’ by the inventors. The vegetable salt contains.</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 150%; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p>Sodium chloride: 85 – 90%</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 150%; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">Potassium chloride: 5 – 10%</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 150%; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">Calcium: 0.5 – 1.50%</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 150%; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">Magnesium: 0.5 – 1.0%</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 150%; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">Copper: 2 – 5ppm</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 150%; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">Iron: 5 – 15ppm</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 150%; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">Zinc: 3 – 10ppm</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 150%; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">Iodine: 3 – 7ppm</SPAN></P><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 150%; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B>Features/Advantages of the product/process:<o:p></o:p></B></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 150%; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="mso-tab-count: 1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN>The main advantages of vegetable salt are,</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: 150%; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1"><SPAN style="mso-list: Ignore">(a)<SPAN style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN></SPAN>Vegetable in origin.</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: 150%; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1"><SPAN style="mso-list: Ignore">(b)<SPAN style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN></SPAN>The farming is organic and the method of preparation of salt is benign i.e. without use of any chemicals.</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: 150%; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1"><SPAN style="mso-list: Ignore">(c)<SPAN style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN></SPAN>The presence of micronutrients not found is sea salt.</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: 150%; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1"><SPAN style="mso-list: Ignore">(d)<SPAN style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN></SPAN>The salt is naturally free flowing and does not require any additives.</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: 150%; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1"><SPAN style="mso-list: Ignore">(e)<SPAN style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN></SPAN>The plants grow on saline wastelands natural inundated with seawater or irrigated with seawater hence not competing with conventional agriculture.</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: 150%; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1"><SPAN style="mso-list: Ignore">(f)<SPAN style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN></SPAN>Large tractor of saline wastelands are available is the vicinity of sea coast and solar salt works can be utilized for cultivation of <I>Salicornia</I> for the productions vegetable salt.</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.5in; LINE-HEIGHT: 150%; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1"><SPAN style="mso-list: Ignore">(g)<SPAN style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN></SPAN>By growing Salicornia on saline soils carbon credit benefits. </SPAN></SPAN></P> <p align="justify"><span>The process of vegetable salt is organic the source material is <i>Salicornia</i> dry biomass. The species grows on costal marshaly saline soils where seawater regularly gets inundated. Input cost will need to be worked out for individual areas, since one has to ascertain whether natural irrigation with seawater (taking advantage of tides) would be feasible or artificial irrigation would be required. Best cost scenario as estimated minimum inputs around 20,000 and maximum around Rs. 40,000 per hectare where artificial irrigations has to be arranged. After deleting the cost for oil for a small scale (3-5ha) the productions cost of salt should be around Rs. 25-30 per kg excluding packing and transport.</span></p>
<span><p class="MsoBodyText"><b><span>Application and target industry:</span></b></p>
<p class="MsoBodyText"><span>Since the vegetable salt contains several important nutrients besides sodium chloride not normally found is sea salt and there for promising as a health salt.</span></p>
<p><span>Target industries., Pharmaceutical industries, Health food industries., Fast food industries., Health care products</span></p>
</span> Obtained US patent No. 6,929,809; PCT patentent Application: PCT/1B/2004/03678; Indian Patent Application :  2370/DEL/2004 herbal salt_2.jpg
2 Preparation of Synthetic hydrotalcite - Halogen scavenger grade and Pharmaceutical grade <p class="MsoNormal" align="justify">Synthetic hydrotalcites (SHT), also known as anionic clays or layered double hydroxides are rarely found in nature. They are functionally akin to zeolites. The structure of SHT is very similar to brucite, Mg(OH)<sub>2</sub>. Magnesium is octahedrally surrounded by six oxygens in the form of hydroxides; the octahedral units then, through edge sharing, form infinite sheets. The sheets are stacked on top of each other through hydrogen bonding. When some of the magnesium in the lattice is isomorphously replaced by higher charged cation, e.g. Al<sup>3+</sup>, then the resulting overall single Mg<sup>2+</sup> - Al<sup>3+</sup> -OH layers gains a positive charge. Sorption of an equivalent amount of hydrated anions render the structure electrically neutral. The anion is frequently found to be carbonate. A typical hydrotalcite may be represented by formula such as Mg<sub>4.5</sub> Al<sub>2</sub>(OH)<sub>13</sub>CO<sub>3</sub>.3H<sub>2</sub>O. Many modification of this structure can be made by changing the Al to Mg ratio.</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" align="justify"><span>SHT finds application in pharmaceutical industry as an antacid. SHT has also replaced heavy metal based heat stabilizers for PVC. SHT like compounds are imported under the trade name like DHT-4A, L-55R-II and Alcamizer. They are used as halogen scavenger in plastic processes such as the production of polypropylene. It deactivates the residual quantities of acidic substances associated with acid catalysts used in producing polymers. CSMCRI has developed processes to prepare pharmaceutical grade and halogen scavenger grade SHT.</span></p> <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align=justify>Bittern and soda ash are reacted to make magnesium precursor. Aluminium sulphate and soda ash solutions are reacted to make aluminium precursor. These precursors are blended and subjected to hydrothermal treatment under optimized conditions. The slurry is filtered,<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN>dried, pulverized and sieved to obtain pharmaceutical grade SHT. To prepare halogen scavenger grade SHT, the slurry is treated with surface modifier to make the material hydrophobic prior to filtration. The cake is washed, dried, pulverized and sieved to obtain halogen scavenger grade SHT.</P> <p class="MsoNormal"><span>HALOGEN SCAVENGER GRADE SYNTHETIC HYDROTALCITE</span></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><b>Project cost : 100 kg/day</b><span>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><span>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><b>Rs.50.00 lakh</b> </p>

3 Electrodialysis Domestic Desalination System <p align="justify"><span>CSMCRI has developed electrodialysis desalination system for domestic uses, which can provide drinking water of WHO specifications from brackish or ground-water with TDS about 3000 ppm. Indigenous ion-exchange membranes and electrodialysis unit used in this system was developed by this institute. Inbuilt ozonator ensures complete destruction of pathogens.</span></p> <P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align=justify><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Electrodialysis (ED) is a membrane process by which ions are separated from making brackish water free from salts. CSMCRI has been in the forefront in developing membranes for ED. Two types of membranes, anion and cation exchange membrane are arranged in an ED stack alternately between two electrodes, kept in electrode chambers. Brackish water is passed between the membranes while a DC electric field is applied across the electrodes. Anions pass through anion exchange membrane and cations through the cation exchange membrane, making the water depleted of salt. Cations cannot pass through the anion exchange membrane and anions do not pass through cation exchange membrane which they encounter in the adjacent compartment and therefore one stream will turn diluate and adjacent stream into the concentrate waste. Both the streams are collected separately. Diluate stream is drinking water and the concentrate stream is discharged.<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </SPAN></SPAN></P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes"></SPAN></SPAN>&nbsp;</P><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes"></SPAN><?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Specification of the Product</SPAN></B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">: <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="mso-bidi-font-size: 7.0pt">Dimensions: 37 x 44 x 53 cm</SPAN><SPAN style="POSITION: relative; TOP: -1.5pt; mso-bidi-font-size: 4.5pt; mso-text-raise: 1.5pt">3</SPAN><SPAN style="mso-bidi-font-size: 7.0pt">; weight: 40 kg.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'">Product water TDS: 500 ppm.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'">Capacity in liters/hour (LPH) to provide 500 ppm drinking water:</SPAN></P>

<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'">For feed concentration 2500 ppm:<SPAN style="mso-tab-count: 1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN>12LPH<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'">For feed concentration 2000 ppm:<SPAN style="mso-tab-count: 1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN>15LPH<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>

<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'">Membrane area: 25 cm X 12 cm<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'">Number of cation and anion exchange membranes: each 30 numbers<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'">Provided with Ozone generator to destroy bacteria/pathogens.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>

<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'"></SPAN>&nbsp;</P><SPAN style="mso-fareast-font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS'">
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Features/Advantages of the Product/Process</SPAN></B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">:<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-ascii-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-hansi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-char-type: symbol; mso-symbol-font-family: Symbol"><SPAN style="mso-char-type: symbol; mso-symbol-font-family: Symbol">Þ</SPAN></SPAN></B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt"> Simple to operate by any person with minimum training.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-ascii-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-hansi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-char-type: symbol; mso-symbol-font-family: Symbol"><SPAN style="mso-char-type: symbol; mso-symbol-font-family: Symbol">Þ</SPAN></SPAN></B><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt"> </SPAN></B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">No moving parts or high-pressure pump is needed.<B><o:p></o:p></B></SPAN></P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.25in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-ascii-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-hansi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-char-type: symbol; mso-symbol-font-family: Symbol"><SPAN style="mso-char-type: symbol; mso-symbol-font-family: Symbol">Þ</SPAN></SPAN></B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Almost all parts are made of plastic material and therefore, there is no corrosion problem.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-ascii-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-hansi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-char-type: symbol; mso-symbol-font-family: Symbol"><SPAN style="mso-char-type: symbol; mso-symbol-font-family: Symbol">Þ</SPAN></SPAN></B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">This system can be combined with solar cells in places without power.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.25in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-ascii-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-hansi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-char-type: symbol; mso-symbol-font-family: Symbol"><SPAN style="mso-char-type: symbol; mso-symbol-font-family: Symbol">Þ</SPAN></SPAN></B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Electrical parts and pump are simple in design and can be repaired by common electrician available in rural areas.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.25in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-ascii-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-hansi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-char-type: symbol; mso-symbol-font-family: Symbol"><SPAN style="mso-char-type: symbol; mso-symbol-font-family: Symbol">Þ</SPAN></SPAN></B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The productivity of the system can be increased or decreased by adjusting flow rates according to the salinity of feed.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.25in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-ascii-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-hansi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-char-type: symbol; mso-symbol-font-family: Symbol"><SPAN style="mso-char-type: symbol; mso-symbol-font-family: Symbol">Þ</SPAN></SPAN></B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Built-in ozonator for guaranteed destruction of pathogens.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.25in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-ascii-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-hansi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-char-type: symbol; mso-symbol-font-family: Symbol"><SPAN style="mso-char-type: symbol; mso-symbol-font-family: Symbol">Þ</SPAN></SPAN></B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Typical life of membranes with proper maintenance is 3-5 years.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.25in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-ascii-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-hansi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-char-type: symbol; mso-symbol-font-family: Symbol"><SPAN style="mso-char-type: symbol; mso-symbol-font-family: Symbol">Þ</SPAN></SPAN></B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">If overhead tank is available no circulation pump is required.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.25in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </SPAN></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 8pt; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Applications and Target industry</SPAN></B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">:<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Domestic uses/public place, for providing purified drinking water.</SPAN></SPAN></o:p></SPAN></P> <p class="hridltrivedi" align="justify"><span>The capital investment for the preparation of ED domestic system would involve an investment of about<b>:</b></span></p>
<p class="hridltrivedi" align="justify"><span><span>1.<span>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span>Rs. 15 Lakhs for the purchase of technology for the preparation of membranes, stack and unit design.</span></p>
<p class="hridltrivedi"><span><span>2.<span>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></span><span>Rs. 25 Lakhs for machinery.</span></p>
<p class="hridltrivedi" align="justify"><span><span>3.<span>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span></span><span>The cost of prototype is estimated at Rs. 12000/, which can be brought down to Rs. 9000/ when produced on large scale.</span></p>
<p class="hridltrivedi"><span><span>4.<span>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span></span><span>The cost of membranes would work out to be Rs. 1000 per m<sup>2</sup> per cell pair.</span></p>
<p class="hridltrivedi" align="justify"><span><span>5.<span>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span></span><span>With the facilities suggested for a single shift with 5 people, membranes for 80 domestic systems can be prepared in a month. The number of units per month will however depend on the rate of fabrication of other components.</span></p> Nil domestic ed.jpg
4 Preparation of novel iodizing agent. <p align="justify"><span>Iodine is a very important trace element necessary in the biosynthesis of thyroid hormones. Iodine is required for developing and maintaining healthy body. There are well known Iodine Deficiency Disorder like Goiter and Cretinism. The edible salt is chosen as vehicle in the provision of iodine because of its uniform consumption and availability to all segments of population independent of social or economic status. During the past twenty years ,there has been strong effort, lead by the United Nationals, to iodize all the salt for human consumption.Potsssium iodate and potassium iodide are most often used in iodizing the edible salt. The Food and Nutrition Board of National Research council of the <country-region w:st="on"></country-region><place w:st="on"></place>USA placed<span>&nbsp; </span>the optimum requirement of iodine at 150-300 ug per day, and considering 10 gm of salt consumption per day, the iodization level of salt could be around 15-30 mg per kg of salt. The impurities present in edible salt, moisture and temperature are some of the main factors that induce loss of iodine from iodized salt. In order of to deliver adequate amount of iodine to the consumer while avoiding the unnecessary excess addition of iodizing agent in salt that is normally done to compensate for losses, it is paramount importance that an ultrastable iodizing agent should be developed. This would allow a simultaneous benefit in as much as it may not be necessary to purify salt excessively as is the practice at present to minimize iodine loss apart from imparting a superior aesthetic effect such as free flow nature. The latter is especially important, as it is well known that impurities such as magnesium are required as micronutrient and can also enhance the saltiness of salt.</span></p> <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align=justify>Bittern and soda ash are reacted to make magnesium precursor. Aluminum trihydrate and caustic soda are reacted to make aluminum precursor. These precursors are blended and subjected to non autogenously thermal treatment under optimized process conditions. The slurry is filtered, washed, dried,pulverized and calcined.To prepare iodizing agent, the calcined mass after cooling is reacted with potassiumiodate solution under control conditions. slurry is filtered using freshly prepares filter aid, washed, pulverized to obtaine compound having stable iodizing agent</P> <p class="MsoNormal">Basis: !000 kg per day sable iodating agent containing 4.5 % Iodine</p>
<p class="MsoNormal">Project cost: Rs. 200 lacs</p>
<p class="MsoNormal">Cost of production: Rs. 135 per kg</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" align="justify">Cost of iodization: 666gm of iodizing agent required per ton of salt;<span>&nbsp; </span>Rs. 90 per ton of salt</p> 1) Preparation of novel iodizing agent and iodised salt there from, NF No NF/0404/2004 2)An improved iodizing agent for enhancing iodine stability, International Application No. PCT /IN2004/000190
5 “CleanWrite” WRITING CHALK <p class="MsoBodyText" align="justify">Chalk has been a traditional teaching aid in school, colleges and institutions. It is likely to continue to play critical role in education in our country, notwithstanding developments around information technology and erasable inks for white boards. It is typically manufactured by small-scale industries with little quality control or formal product specifications. Its requirement is estimated to exceed 100,000 ton per annum in the country, assuming 300 million people using chalk one way or the other.</p> <P class=MsoBodyTextIndent2 style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt" align=justify>We have developed calcium carbonate based superior quality extruded writing chalk having high bulk density, smooth finish, dust-free nature, ability to withstand easy breakage, negligible sensitivity towards moisture, good visibility of writing, and easy wiping. One such chalk piece can write as much as 3-4 regular chalk pieces.</P>
<P class=MsoBodyTextIndent2 style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<P class=MsoBodyTextIndent2 style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'"><EM>Product Features &amp; Specifications:</EM></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoBodyTextIndent2 style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'"><EM></EM></SPAN>&nbsp;</P><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'"><EM></EM></SPAN>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt">Length, cm<SPAN style="mso-tab-count: 3">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN>6.5</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt">Diameter, mm<SPAN style="mso-tab-count: 3">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN>10.5-10</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt">Weight, gm<SPAN style="mso-tab-count: 3">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN>8.24</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt">Density, gms/cc<SPAN style="mso-tab-count: 2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN>1.12</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt">Writing length, m<SPAN style="mso-tab-count: 2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN>8.24</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt">Dust, %<SPAN style="mso-tab-count: 3">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN>1.00</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt">Quality of dust <SPAN style="mso-tab-count: 2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN>Crystalline</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt">Tablet Hardness, Kg<SPAN style="mso-tab-count: 2">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN>5.0</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt">Breakage (30cm fall), %<SPAN style="mso-tab-count: 1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN>12</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt">Base material<SPAN style="mso-tab-count: 3">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN>CaCO<SUB>3</SUB></P> Please contact Director, CSMCRI, Bhavnagar Nil chalk.jpg
6 Preparation of low sodium salt of botanic origin <p class="MsoBodyText" align="justify"><span>Low sodium salt is a mixture of sodium chloride and potassium chloride and is useful for those persons who have been advised to eat less common salt because of medical problems like hypertension. It is further known that the deleterious action of common table salt is due to sodium content thereof, since it is the sodium in the form of sodium ions, which must be avoided.<span>&nbsp; </span>It is also known that potassium salt, a mineral present in many fruits, vegetables and legumes, protects against high blood pressure by inhibiting sodium-induced hypertension.<span>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </span></span></p>
<p class="MsoBodyText"></p>
<p align="justify"><span>In the present technology, the preparation of <span>&nbsp;</span><span>&nbsp;</span>nutrient rich slow sodium salts, from high salt accumulating and edible oil-bearing salt tolerant plant, <i>Salicornia</i> <i>brachiata</i>, and a red alga, <i>Eucheuma</i>, a carrageenophyte, is described as byproducts.<span>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Specifically, the present invention describes the preparation of low sodium salt (Saloni K) exclusively from vegetable origin by using, in combination, plant by-products and then processing under aqueous conditions with maximum process efficiency to obtain low sodium salts of desired composition in a cost-effective manner.<span>&nbsp; </span>Besides the obvious attraction of being of vegetable origin, which would be preferred by many people including strict vegetarians, the low sodium salts is heat sterilized and contains small quantities (5-10 ppm) of iodine and some other essential micronutrients.<span>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>The process is importantbased on the fact that cultivation of plants such as <i>Salicornia</i> and <i>Eucheuma</i> becomes more economically attractive in view of the utilization of by-products of these plants for the production of value added product like Saloni K.</span></p> <P align=justify><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">The<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </SPAN>process for the preparation of low sodium salt of botanic origin<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN>comprises of (i) adding appropriate quantity of potassium chloride-containing crude salt from <I style="mso-bidi-font-style: normal">Eucheuma</I><SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN>into the residual <I style="mso-bidi-font-style: normal">Salicornia </I>biomass after removal of oil-bearing seeds and subjecting it to incineration by making use of the high lignin content and other organic matter in it to sustain ignition without external energy input; (ii) repeated leaching of salt from the residual ash with appropriate quantity of water; (iii) combining the filtrates from step (ii) above; (iv) concentrating the salt solution in an evaporator, filtering and drying salt in oven.</SPAN></P><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align=justify><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Specification of the Product</SPAN></B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt"> : The product is white in color, granular and free flowing in nature having following chemical composition. <?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt">Chemical composition of<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN>Saloni K</P>

<TD style="BORDER-RIGHT: windowtext 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 5.4pt; BORDER-TOP: #d4d0c8; PADDING-LEFT: 5.4pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; BORDER-LEFT: windowtext 1pt solid; WIDTH: 151.1pt; PADDING-TOP: 0in; BORDER-BOTTOM: windowtext 1pt solid; BACKGROUND-COLOR: transparent; mso-border-alt: solid windowtext .5pt; mso-border-top-alt: solid windowtext .5pt" vAlign=top width=201>

<TD style="BORDER-RIGHT: windowtext 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 5.4pt; BORDER-TOP: #d4d0c8; PADDING-LEFT: 5.4pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; BORDER-LEFT: #d4d0c8; WIDTH: 145.65pt; PADDING-TOP: 0in; BORDER-BOTTOM: windowtext 1pt solid; BACKGROUND-COLOR: transparent; mso-border-alt: solid windowtext .5pt; mso-border-left-alt: solid windowtext .5pt; mso-border-top-alt: solid windowtext .5pt" vAlign=top width=194>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center" align=center>53.98</P></TD></TR>
<TR style="mso-yfti-irow: 7">
<TD style="BORDER-RIGHT: windowtext 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 5.4pt; BORDER-TOP: #d4d0c8; PADDING-LEFT: 5.4pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; BORDER-LEFT: windowtext 1pt solid; WIDTH: 151.1pt; PADDING-TOP: 0in; BORDER-BOTTOM: windowtext 1pt solid; BACKGROUND-COLOR: transparent; mso-border-alt: solid windowtext .5pt; mso-border-top-alt: solid windowtext .5pt" vAlign=top width=201>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center" align=center>Iodine</P></TD>
<TD style="BORDER-RIGHT: windowtext 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 5.4pt; BORDER-TOP: #d4d0c8; PADDING-LEFT: 5.4pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; BORDER-LEFT: #d4d0c8; WIDTH: 145.65pt; PADDING-TOP: 0in; BORDER-BOTTOM: windowtext 1pt solid; BACKGROUND-COLOR: transparent; mso-border-alt: solid windowtext .5pt; mso-border-left-alt: solid windowtext .5pt; mso-border-top-alt: solid windowtext .5pt" vAlign=top width=194>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center" align=center>3-5ppm</P></TD></TR>
<TR style="mso-yfti-irow: 8; mso-yfti-lastrow: yes">
<TD style="BORDER-RIGHT: windowtext 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 5.4pt; BORDER-TOP: #d4d0c8; PADDING-LEFT: 5.4pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; BORDER-LEFT: windowtext 1pt solid; WIDTH: 151.1pt; PADDING-TOP: 0in; BORDER-BOTTOM: windowtext 1pt solid; BACKGROUND-COLOR: transparent; mso-border-alt: solid windowtext .5pt; mso-border-top-alt: solid windowtext .5pt" vAlign=top width=201>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center" align=center>Micronutrients </P></TD>
<TD style="BORDER-RIGHT: windowtext 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 5.4pt; BORDER-TOP: #d4d0c8; PADDING-LEFT: 5.4pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; BORDER-LEFT: #d4d0c8; WIDTH: 145.65pt; PADDING-TOP: 0in; BORDER-BOTTOM: windowtext 1pt solid; BACKGROUND-COLOR: transparent; mso-border-alt: solid windowtext .5pt; mso-border-left-alt: solid windowtext .5pt; mso-border-top-alt: solid windowtext .5pt" vAlign=top width=194>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center" align=center>Trace</P></TD></TR></TBODY></TABLE></P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Features/Advantages of the Product/Process</SPAN></B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt"> : </SPAN></P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The main advantages of the vegetable salt are (a) vegetable in origin, (b) both the plant sources grow on saline soils /seawater<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </SPAN>and hence not competing with other crops for land and water<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </SPAN>(c) the cultivation is organic (d) the process of preparation of salt is be benign (without use of any chemicals) and (e) the presence of micronutrients not found is sea salt. These salts can also be tailored to desired nutrient composition. The salt is free flowing and does not need any additive for the purpose. Since it is a green technology it is environmental friendly<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Applications and Target industry: </SPAN></B></P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt"></SPAN></B><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">The product is useful for those persons who have been advised to eat less common salt because of medical problems like hypertension<B> </B>and also preferred by strict vegetarians.<B> Pharmaceutical company</B> : The technology has already been transferred to N S Pharma, Bhavanagar </SPAN></P></SPAN> <p align="justify"><span>The process technology for preparation of vegetable salts has been developed on pilot plant scale of 100kg per day. The cost of production in a plant of 1 tpd capacity works out to be Rs. 15 per kg. </span></p> Low sodium salt of botanic origin, US and PCT patent applications filed No. 0073NF2004 dated April 06,2004. saloni-k-1_1.jpg saloni-k-1.jpg
7 Fabrication of community scale desalination plants including animal powered and solar powered desalination units <p align="justify"><span>Indian villages have more than 28 million hp of animal energy per day for agricultural operations. More than 80% are working bullocks. Although it is difficult to estimate monetary value of animal energy, but one estimate places it in the range of Rs.300 to 500 crores. In <country-region w:st="on"><place w:st="on">India</place></country-region>, animal energy/power is mainly used for ploughing and drawing carts. It is estimated that bullock carts meet more than 60% of the transportation needs of agriculture sector in <country-region w:st="on"><place w:st="on">India</place></country-region>. </span><span>Animal power is normally more available and affordable to people in rural areas and fragile environments. Animal power requires little or no foreign exchange. Money spent on motors and machinery is exported from rural areas whereas Money invested in animal power circulates within rural areas, helping to revitalize rural economies. Animal power is a renewable energy source that can be sustained in rural areas with little external input. </span><span>Animal energy potential in <country-region w:st="on"><place w:st="on">India</place></country-region> is enormous and therefore it is wise to utilize this energy for providing drinking water for the villages having brackish ground water.</span></p> <P align=justify><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">Water desalination by Reverse Osmosis (RO). RO is a membrane separation process in which the sea-water/brackish-water permeates through a membrane by applying a pressure larger than the osmotic pressure of sea-water/brackish-water. The membrane is permeable for water, but not for the dissolved salts. In this way, a separation between a pure water fraction (the permeate) and a concentrated fraction (concentrate) is obtained. Pressures needed for the separation are in the range of 50 bars for sea-water, 20 bars for brackish-water. Most RO membranes are polymeric thin film composite(TFC) membranes, consisting of a very thin separating layer and a number of supporting layers with much lower resistance against mass transport. The membranes are usually configured in spiral-wound modules, where the sea-water/brackish-water flows between two flat membrane sheets wrapped around a central tube. The advantage of RO is the low cost of the product water which can be Rs. 22.5- 31.5/m<SUP>3</SUP>, compared to Rs.45.0 – 63.0/m<SUP>3</SUP> for MSF and MED, depending on energy cost. Energy consumption in RO is low compared to distillation processes, although pumping costs are still considerable. The permeate quality is very good with total dissolved solids concentrations between 100 and 500 ppm. </SPAN></P>
<P><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><STRONG>Specification of the Product</STRONG></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">: </SPAN></SPAN></P>
<P align=justify><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">Animal powered water desalination process consisting mechanical link, speed increaser, high pressure pump and membrane elements for desalination of brackish water have total dissolved solids (TDS) up to 5000 ppm. Product water rate and quality obtained will be in the range of 500-700 LPH and 200- 500 ppm consequently.</SPAN></SPAN></P><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal">Features/Advantages of the Product/Process</B>:<SPAN style="mso-fareast-font-family: Arial"> </SPAN>Animal power water desalination requires little or no foreign exchange. Money spent on motors and machinery is exported from rural areas whereas Money invested in animal power circulates within rural areas, helping to revitalize rural economies.</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&nbsp;</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal">Applications and Target industry</B>: Villages and village industry</P></SPAN></SPAN> <p align="justify"><span>Animal powered water desalination is economical in rural areas where electric power is irregular or not available. Animal power requires little or no foreign exchange. Money spent on motors and machinery is exported from rural areas whereas Money invested in animal power circulates within rural areas, helping to revitalize rural economies</span></p> Animal powered mechanical device for water desalination. Patent number: PCT/IB02/05606 animal ro-1_2.jpg animal ro-1_1.jpg animal ro-1.jpg
8 Simultaneous production of liquid seaweed fertilizer and seaweed granules containing kappa carrageenan from Kappaphycus alvarezii <p class="MsoNormal" align="justify">In <place w:st="on"><country-region w:st="on">India</country-region></place>, brown seaweeds are represented mainly by <i>Sargassum spp</i>., which are found to be a good source of fertilizer because of the mineral and growth hormone content and can be used as compost also. Seaweed extracts are being sold in the international market under different trade names as foliar spray such as Sea sol, Maxi crop cytozyme, Sea spray, SM3, Cylex, Sea crop, Algit super, Algifert, Marinure, Geomore, Kelpak, Sea more, Algal Spray, etc. These extracts are produced from a variety of brown seaweeds like <i>Ascophyllum, Macrocytis, Laminaria, Ecklonia, Durvellea, Carpophyllum, </i>and<i> Sargassum</i>. Major bulk producers are USA Cytozyme, Maxicrop, Chase Organics, Marinure, Algistin and Glenorganic. In India SPIC Cytozyme, Chennai and a few companies in <place w:st="on">Gujarat</place> are producers of liquid seaweed fertilizer.</p>
<p class="MsoNormal"></p>
<p align="justify"><span>The value of seaweed extract is not judged from its NPK value, but it is decided from the trace elements and growth promoting substances like cytokinins, auxins, gibberllins and other sugar compounds present in it. Seaweed extracts have been proved to have good effect on vegetables, fruits, cereals, and pulses with considerable increase in the quality and quantity of the product. Besides this, it acts as a frost and pest resistant and reduces flower and fruit dropout.</span></p> <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align=justify>Seaweed, <I>Sargassum</I>, is collected from seacoast and thoroughly cleaned with fresh seawater to remove extraneous matter, sun dried before shifted to process house. The dried seaweed is ground to a 60-mesh size powder and is used in the process.</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align=justify>&nbsp;</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-font-family: SimSun; mso-fareast-language: ZH-CN; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">In the first step, seaweed powder is mixed with tap water and mixture is kept overnight with occasional stirring. Next day morning mixture, it is filtered out and solid mass is cooked in hot water. Later on hot slurry is filtered out. The solid mass is once again cooked in alkaline medium and slurry is filtered. Filtrate in all the three steps is the product known as liquid seaweed fertilizer. Filtrate received after cooking is concentrated in the evaporator to reduce the volume. Later on it is mixed with the cold filtrate collected in the first step. The liquid product is stored in the storage vessel and then packed in the containers. To avoid bacterial and fungus growth in the liquid suitable preservatives are added in the final product.</SPAN></P><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-font-family: SimSun; mso-fareast-language: ZH-CN; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA"></SPAN>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt"></SPAN></B>&nbsp;</P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Specification of the Product<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></SPAN></B></P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoListBullet style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: left" align=left><SPAN lang=EN-GB style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'"><STRONG><EM>Typical composition of <?xml:namespace prefix = st1 ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" /><st1:place w:st="on"><st1:PlaceName w:st="on">Liquid</st1:PlaceName> <st1:PlaceType w:st="on">Sea</st1:PlaceType></st1:place> Weed Fertilizer based on CSMCRI Technology<o:p></o:p></EM></STRONG></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&nbsp;</P>

<TD style="BORDER-RIGHT: black 1pt solid; PADDING-RIGHT: 5.4pt; BORDER-TOP: #d4d0c8; PADDING-LEFT: 5.4pt; PADDING-BOTTOM: 0in; BORDER-LEFT: black 1pt solid; WIDTH: 157.5pt; PADDING-TOP: 0in; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 1pt solid; BACKGROUND-COLOR: transparent; mso-border-alt: solid black .75pt; mso-border-top-alt: solid black .75pt" vAlign=top width=210>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">Calcium<o:p></o:p></P></TD>

<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">65<o:p></o:p></P></TD></TR></TBODY></TABLE>&nbsp;&nbsp;</P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Features/Advantages of the Product/Process<o:p></o:p></SPAN></B></P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">(i) The integrated process as illustrated with <I>Kappaphycus alvarezii </I>allows both &#954;-carrageenan and liquid seaweed fertilizer to be recovered from fresh seaweed which would make cultivation of the seaweed more lucrative. For a one hectare area of cultivation—which conservatively yields 100 tons of fresh biomass per annum—60-80 tons of liquid biofertilizer can be produced in addition to 2.5-4.5 tons of &#954;-carrageenan, depending on the grade. </P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">(ii) The sap—which has proven efficacy as biofertilizer—is obtained without thermo-chemical cycling and external addition of water. It may be marketed directly requiring no further processing other than addition of preservatives. </P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">(iii) Simple equipment such as a grinder-cum-mixer and a press filter installed preferably near the site of harvesting may suffice for homogenizing the fresh seaweed and allowing sap to be separated. </P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">(iv) As compared to the ca. 850-900 kg water that needs to be removed from one ton of fresh <I>Kappaphycus alvarezii </I>as per the conventional method of drying the whole plant, only the moisture in the wet residue—amounting to 100-200 kg per ton of fresh seaweed—needs to be removed as per the method of the invention thereby greatly reducing drying time and area. </P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">(v) The free flowing, granular residue obtained from the fresh plant is superior to dried whole plant as raw material for &#954;-carrageenan since the former is less bulky, easy to transport, easy to store, easy to handle, contains very little colour, has a higher &#954;-carrageenan content, and can even be used directly for gel formation in certain applications.</P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt"></SPAN></B>&nbsp;</P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">Applications and Target industry</SPAN></B></P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=hridltrivedi style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">This technology gives simultaneously two products from fresh seaweed: (i) Liquid biofertilizer has proven efficacy as foliar spray in plants (ii) </SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-ascii-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-hansi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-char-type: symbol; mso-symbol-font-family: Symbol"><SPAN style="mso-char-type: symbol; mso-symbol-font-family: Symbol">k</SPAN></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">-carrageenan enriched granular material may be used directly in application for gel formation or the material can be used for producing refined and semi refined </SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: Symbol; mso-ascii-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-hansi-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-char-type: symbol; mso-symbol-font-family: Symbol"><SPAN style="mso-char-type: symbol; mso-symbol-font-family: Symbol">k</SPAN></SPAN><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt">-carrageenan, which have many applications in food and pharmaceutical industries.<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&nbsp;</P> <p class="MsoNormal" align="justify">For a one hectare area of cultivation—which conservatively yields 100 tons of fresh biomass per annum—60-80 tons of liquid biofertilizer can be produced in addition to 2.5-4.5 tons of &#954;-carrageenan, depending on the grade. </p>
<p class="MsoNormal"></p>
<p class="MsoNormal"><b>Price:</b></p>
<p class="MsoNormal">The Seaweed: Rs20.00 per kg</p>
<p class="hridltrivedi"><span>&#954;-carrageenan: Rs100.00 to Rs150.00 per kg for semirefined &#954;-carrageenan.<span>&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span></p> 1) Integrated Method For Production Of Carrageenan And Liquid Fertiliser From Fresh Seaweeds, Indian application No.0133DEL2003. 2) Intergrated Method For Production Of Carrageenan And Liquid Fertiliser From Fresh Sea Weeds, US Patent 6,893,479; May 17, 2005; PCT application No. PCT/IB02/04122; Filed Indonesia on 21/02/2005, Number awaited. lsf-1_1.jpg lsf-1.jpg
9 Integrated Process For The Recovery Of Salt & Marine Chemicals <p class="MsoNormal" align="justify">India ranks third among the salt producing countries of the world with an annual production of 17.0 million tons per annum. The institute has developed and patented an innovative process for the recovery of high purity salt integrated with the recovery of marine chemicals. In the field of chemical technology, this invention relates to integrated recovery of salt and marine chemicals and to a method of preparing them. More particularly this invention relates to recovery of salt and marine chemicals from sub soil brine of <place w:st="on"></place>Gujarat and Rajasthan.</p>
<p class="MsoNormal" align="justify">The preparation of inorganic salts and marine chemicals from sea brine has been known for sometimes. A naturally occurring sub-soil brine/sea brine<span>&nbsp; </span>containing Ca<sup>2+</sup>, Mg<sup>2+</sup>, Na+, Cl<sup>-</sup> , SO<sub>4</sub><sup>2-</sup> can be treated to produce common salt, calcium sulphate, potassium chloride, bromine, high purity magnesium chloride and magnesia in an integrated manner. The common salt apart from being an essential dietary component, it is a basic raw material for the manufacture of a wide variety of industrial chemicals viz. Sodium Carbonate (Soda ash), Sodium hydroxide (Caustic soda), and chlorine. Besides, salt is used in textile, dairy, dyeing, food, fertilizer, paper, and pharmaceutical industries. Marine gypsum is used in cement industries and in the preparation of high strength Plaster of Paris. It can also be used as a source of calcium in the preparation of calcium based siliceous chemicals. Magnesium compounds find applications in agriculture, refractories, pharmaceuticals, rubber, polymer additives and fire retardant. Potash is an essential plant nutrient and chemical grade KCl is used for making other important potash chemicals. </p> <P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt" align=justify>A new process for recovery of common salt, potassium chloride, concentrated magnesium chloride with enriched bromide, and high purity magnesia from brine in an integrated manner.<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </SPAN>The process comprises, desulphatation of brine with calcium chloride solution either produced in situ or distiller waste liquor containing calcium chloride, solar evaporation of desulphated brine, production of sodium chloride of superior quality in solar pans, solar evaporation of bittern thereby producing carnallite and end bittern, processing carnallite through established processes to produce Low sodium salt /Potassium chloride, producing end bittern containing highly concentrated magnesium chloride and enriched bromide and calcinations of such end bittern after solidification to produce high purity magnesia and hydrochloric acid utilizable. </P> Please contact: Director, CSMCRI, Bhavnagar, India A process for the recovery of common salt and marine chemicals from brine in integrated manner, US Patent No: 6,776,972 dated 17 August 2004 integ salt-1_1.jpg integ salt-1.jpg
10 Potassium Sulphate From Sulphate Rich Bittern <p align="justify"><span>SOP is a dual fertilizer containing 50% K<sub>2</sub>O and 18% S.<span>&nbsp; </span>It has the lowest salt index and is virtually free of chloride, which makes it a superior fertilizer to muriate of potash (MOP).<span>&nbsp; </span>On the other hand, MOP is easy to produce especially when brine/bittern is low in sulphate content such as in the <place w:st="on">Dead Sea</place> and this accounts for its lower price compared to SOP.<span>&nbsp;&nbsp; </span>Countries such as <country-region w:st="on"><place w:st="on">India</place></country-region>, which do not have low sulphate bittern, but which have adequate bittern of sea and sub-soil origin, would be greatly benefited if SOP can be produced economically from such bittern sources. Besides its application as a fertilizer, potassium sulphate has numerous industrial applications as well.</span></p> <P align=justify><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">The invention relates to a novel integrated process for the recovery of sulphate of potash (SOP) from sulphate rich bittern. The process requires only bittern and lime as raw materials. Kainite mixed salt is obtained by fractional crystallization of the bittern. Kainite is converted into schoenite with simultaneous removal of NaCl in a single step and the filtrate (SEL) is used for production of muriate of potash (MOP).<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </SPAN>The schoenite is reacted with MOP in presence of water to yield SOP and the filtrate (KEL) is recycled in the kainite to schoenite conversion step.<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </SPAN>The production of MOP from SEL is carried out by desulphating the latter, which promotes carnallite formation.<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </SPAN>Desulphatation is carried out with CaCl<SUB>2</SUB> generated from the reaction of carnallite decomposed liquor with hydrated lime. The by-product magnesium hydroxide can be converted into caustic calcined magnesia with &gt;95% purity and B<SUB>2</SUB>O<SUB>3</SUB> impurity content less than 0.03%.<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN>Gypsum and NaCl are the other products obtained in the process.<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </SPAN>Utilisation of all effluent and intermediate streams allow for an overall SOP yield &gt;90% w.r.t. the potash content in the mixed salt.<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </SPAN>These together with the production of valuable co-products make the process economically viable.</SPAN></P><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 12pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA">
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><B style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal">Salient Features<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></B></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">CSMCRI identified the huge reserves of salt &amp; potash in the form of natural bittern <SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;&nbsp;</SPAN>available at Greater Rann of Kutch (GRK)</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">Sulphate of potash is a superior potash fertilizer as compared to muriate of potash due to its low salt index and its double nutrient value. </P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">Production of sulphate of potash fertilizer from bittern being demonstrated to M/s. ABC &amp; Sons, Mumbai</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">A semi commercial plant for producing 2500 TPA of sulphate of potash fertilizer will be<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </SPAN>set up at GRK for M/s. ABC &amp; Sons, Mumbai with financial assistance from TIFAC, <?xml:namespace prefix = st1 ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" /><st1:City w:st="on"><st1:place w:st="on">New Delhi</st1:place></st1:City> under their home grown technology program.</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="mso-bidi-font-size: 24.0pt">Integrated process developed by CSMCRI fully utilizes potash in kainite to produce sulphate of potash (SOP) along with gypsum and MgO. <o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="mso-bidi-font-size: 24.0pt"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><SPAN style="mso-bidi-font-size: 24.0pt">Lime and bittern are the only raw materials required for the process.</SPAN></SPAN></P> Please contact: Director, CSMCRI, Bhavnagar, India US Patent Applications No. 10/814,778, Dated. 30-03-2004 sop-1_2.jpg sop-1_1.jpg sop-1.jpg

<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center" align=center><B style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Arial Narrow'; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><EM>Quantity<o:p></o:p></EM></SPAN></B></P></TD></TR>
