<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right" align=right><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></SPAN></P>
<H2 style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt" align=right><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; mso-bidi-font-size: 10.0pt">Section Officer (S&amp;P) / Controller of Stores &amp; Purchase<o:p></o:p></SPAN></H2>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: right" align=right><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt">for Director<o:p></o:p></SPAN></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-JUSTIFY: inter-ideograph; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-margin-top-alt: auto; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; tab-stops: 76.5pt 1.25in 3.0in"><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt; FONT-FAMILY: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-font-family: 'Times New Roman'; mso-fareast-language: EN-US; mso-ansi-language: EN-US; mso-bidi-language: AR-SA; mso-bidi-font-size: 12.0pt"><BR style="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: always; mso-special-character: line-break" clear=all></SPAN><o:p></o:p></SPAN></B>&nbsp;</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-JUSTIFY: inter-ideograph; MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.25in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-margin-top-alt: auto; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .25in left 76.5pt 1.25in 3.0in"><o:p></o:p></SPAN>&nbsp;</P> Performa Information Sheet.pdf 2006-01-02 10:36:59
7 NOTICE INVITING TENDERS NO.  2/05-06 2006-02-08 2006-02-21 13:00:00 Contract for Security Services <FONT size=2>
<P class=MsoBodyText style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt" align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman,Times,serif">Competitive sealed Tenders are invited in the prescribed format<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </SPAN>by the Director, Central Salt &amp; Marine Chemicals Research Institute, Gijubhai Badheka Marg, Bhavnagar-364002 from registered contractors holding valid licence under Contract Labour (Regulation and Abolition) Act, for monitoring movement of men, material &amp; vehicles, surveillance of vital installations of CSMCRI and its Pot Culture House, Guest Houses, and its Experimental Salt Farm, Kumbharwada, Bhavnagar for an initial period of one year with effect from <B>1.3.2006</B> as per laid down contractual obligations and renewable by up to two more years subject to satisfactory performance.</FONT></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align=justify><?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p><FONT face="Times New Roman,Times,serif">&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman,Times,serif">Total <B>08</B> security points are to be manned round the clock. All the guards provided shall be at least <?xml:namespace prefix = st1 ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" /><st1:place w:st="on"><st1:PlaceName w:st="on">VIII</st1:PlaceName> <st1:PlaceName w:st="on">std.</st1:PlaceName> <st1:PlaceType w:st="on">Pass</st1:PlaceType></st1:place>, medically &amp; physically fit persons of high integrity and good conduct - to the maximum extent possible ex-servicemen below the age of 50 years. The ex-servicemen security guards will be paid @skilled workers as applicable in <st1:place w:st="on"><st1:PlaceName w:st="on">Gujarat</st1:PlaceName> <st1:PlaceType w:st="on">State</st1:PlaceType></st1:place> as notified by the Regional Labour Commissioner (C) from time to time. The other category of security guards who can be provided belongs to Ex-Para military forces/SRP/Police/Home Guards. The other category security guards will be paid @ semi-skilled workers as applicable in <st1:place w:st="on"><st1:PlaceName w:st="on">Gujarat</st1:PlaceName> <st1:PlaceType w:st="on">State</st1:PlaceType></st1:place> as notified by the Regional Labour Commissioner (C) from time to time.</FONT></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align=justify><o:p><FONT face="Times New Roman,Times,serif">&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman,Times,serif"><SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;</SPAN>In addition to the above the agency should fulfill the following requirements:-</FONT></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.75in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.5in; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .75in" align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman,Times,serif"><SPAN style="mso-list: Ignore">1.<SPAN style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN></SPAN>The agency must have minimum two years experience in providing such services to Govt./Semi Govt. or well-known private organizations and must produce documentary evidence to this effect. They should have at least two similar on going works engaging at least 21 security guards at each site. Documentary proof should be attached.</FONT></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.75in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.5in; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .75in" align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman,Times,serif"><SPAN style="mso-list: Ignore">2.<SPAN style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN></SPAN>The agency should have a valid licence with Regional Labour Commissioner (Central) to execute such nature of labour contracts for their on going works. In addition they should have certificate of registration for EPF, ESI, Prof. Tax, ITCC (PAN), Service Tax etc.</FONT></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.75in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.5in; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .75in" align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman,Times,serif"><SPAN style="mso-list: Ignore">3.<SPAN style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN></SPAN>The agency must have, at all times, a responsible individual residing within Bhavnagar Municipal limits.</FONT></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align=justify><o:p><FONT face="Times New Roman,Times,serif">&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></P>
<P class=MsoBodyText style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt" align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman,Times,serif">Director, CSMCRI reserves the right to accept or reject any tender bids without assigning any reasons whatsoever and his decision will be binding on all the parties. Tender documents of contractors not producing proof of possessing above item Nos.1,2&amp;3 will be summarily rejected.</FONT></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align=justify><o:p><FONT face="Times New Roman,Times,serif">&nbsp;</FONT></o:p></P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman,Times,serif">Tender papers along with terms &amp; conditions can be downloaded from the Institute’s website: </FONT><A href="http://www.csmcri.org/"><FONT face="Times New Roman,Times,serif">www.csmcri.org</FONT></A><FONT face="Times New Roman,Times,serif">. The tender papers can also be collected from the Institute’s administration on a payment of Rs.500/- in cash or D.D (non-refundable). The duly completed tenders may be submitted in a sealed cover, superscribed <U>Tender for Security</U>, addressed to the Director, Central Salt &amp; Marine Chemicals Research Institute, G.B.Marg, Bhavnagar-364002 upto 1.00 PM on <B><U>21.02.06</U></B> along with<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </SPAN>tender paper fee of Rs.500/- (non-refundable) and Rs.30,000/- towards EMD in form of D.Ds in favour of the Director, CSMCRI, Bhavnagar. Both the amounts i.e. Rs.500/- and Rs.30,000/- should be paid through separate DDs and placed in the sealed cover containing the tender. <SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp;</SPAN>In case the tender papers have been purchased from the Institute’s administration, a copy of the money receipt must be enclosed. The tenders will be opened on <B><U>21.02.06</U></B> at <st1:time w:st="on" Hour="15" Minute="0">3.00 PM</st1:time>.</FONT></P></FONT> <FONT size=2>
<H2 style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt" align=justify><FONT size=2><?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p>&nbsp;</FONT></H2>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align=justify>Terms and Conditions for award of contract for providing security services for Monitoring movement of men, material &amp; vehicles, surveillance of vital installations of CSMCRI and its Pot Culture House, Guest Houses, and its Experimental Salt Farm, Kumbharwada, Bhavnagar, comprising of eight security point round the clock.</P>
<P class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align=justify><B><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></B></P>
<P class=MsoBodyText style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt 0.5in; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25in; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in" align=justify><SPAN style="mso-list: Ignore">1.<SPAN style="FONT: 7pt 'Times New Roman'">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </SPAN></SPAN>On award of Contract, the Contractor shall obtain the necessary licence under the Contract Labour (Regulation and Abolition) Act, 1970 within a month, at his own cost<SPAN style="mso-spacerun: yes">&nbsp; </SPAN>and comply with the provisions of the act and the rules made there under by the Government from time to time.</P>
<P class=MsoBodyText style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt" align=justify><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></P>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=2>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>That the persons deployed by the contractor for the services mentioned above shall be the employees of the contractor for all intents and purposes and that the persons so deployed shall remain under the control and supervision of the contractor and in no case, shall a relationship of employer and employee between the said persons and the CSIR shall accrue/arise implicitly or explicitly.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=3>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>That on taking over the responsibility of the work assigned the Contractor shall formulate the mechanism and duty assignment of work to its personnel in consultation with Director, CSMCRI or his nominee. Subsequently, the contractor shall review the work assigned from time to time and advise the Director, CSMCRI for further streamlining their system. The contractor shall further be bound by and carry out the directions/instructions given to him by the Director, CSMCRI or the officer designated by the Director in this respect from time to time.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=4>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>That the Director, CSMCRI or any other persons authorized by the Director shall be at liberty to carry out surprise check on the persons as deployed by the contractor in order to ensure that persons deployed by him are doing their duties.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=5>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>That in case any of the persons so deployed by the contractor does not come up to the mark or does not perform his duties properly or commits misconduct or indulges in any unlawful riots or disorderly conduct, the contractor shall immediately withdraw and take suitable action against such persons on the report of the Institute/CSIR in this respect. Further, the contractor shall immediately replace the particular person so deployed on the demand of the Director of the Institute/CSIR in case any of the aforesaid acts on the part of the said person.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=6>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>That the contractor shall carefully and diligently perform the work assigned to him in consultation with the Institute.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=7>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>That for performing the assigned work, the contractor shall deploy at least <?xml:namespace prefix = st1 ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" /><st1:place w:st="on"><st1:PlaceName w:st="on">VIII</st1:PlaceName> <st1:PlaceName w:st="on">std.</st1:PlaceName> <st1:PlaceType w:st="on">Pass</st1:PlaceType></st1:place>, medically and physically fit persons. The contractor shall ensure that the persons are punctual and disciplined and remain vigilant in performance of their duty. The persons so engaged by the contractor shall to the maximum extent possible be from amongst the retired/released ex-service personnel of high integrity and good conduct below the age of 50 years. The other category of security guards who can be provided belongs to Ex-Para military forces/SRP/Police/Home Guards.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=8>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>That the contractor shall submit details, such as names, parentage, residential address, age, etc. of the persons deployed by him in the premises of the CSMCRI/CSIR. For the purpose of proper identification of the employees of the contractor deployed for the work, he shall issue identity cards bearing their photographs/identification etc. and such employees shall display their identity cards at the time of duty.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=9>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>That the contractor shall be liable for the payment of wages and all other dues which they are entitled to receive under the various labour laws and other statutory provisions.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=10>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>That the contractor shall at his own cost, if required, take necessary insurance cover in respect of the aforesaid services rendered to CSMCRI/CSIR and shall comply with the statutory provisions of Contract Labour (Regulation &amp; Abolition) Act, 1970; Employees State Insurance Act; Workman’s Compensation Act, 1923; Payment of Wages Act, 1936; The Employees Provident Fund (and Miscellaneous Provisions) Act, 1952; Payment of Bonus Act, 1965; The Minimum Wages Act, 1948; Employer’s Liability Act, 1938; Employment of Children Act, 1938, Maternity Benefit Act and/or any other rules/regulations and/or statutes that may be applicable to them.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=11>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>That the contractor shall be solely responsible for any violation of provision of the labour laws or any other statutory provisions and shall further keep the CSIR indemnified from all acts of omission, fault, breaches and/or any claim, demand, loss, injury and expense arising out from the non-compliance of the aforesaid statutory provisions. Contractor’s failure to fulfill any of the obligations hereunder and/or under the said Acts, rules/regulations and/or any bye-laws or rules framed under or any of these, the CSIR shall be entitled to recover any of the such losses or expenses, which it may have to suffer or incur on account of such claims, demand, loss or injury, from the contractor’s monthly payment.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=12>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>That the contractor shall be required to maintain permanent attendance register/roll within the building premises which will be open for inspection and checking by the authorized officers of CSMCRI/CSIR.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=13>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>That the contractor shall make the payment of wages, etc. to the persons so deployed in the presence of representative of the CSMCRI/CSIR and shall on demand furnish copies of wage register/muster roll, etc. to the Institute for having paid all the dues to the persons deployed by him for the work under the Agreement. This obligation is imposed on the contractor to ensure that he is fulfilling his commitments, towards his employees so deployed, under various Labour Laws, having regard to the duties of CSMCRI/CSIR in this respect as per the provisions of Contract Labour (Regulation and Abolition) Act, 1970. The contractor shall comply with or cause to be complied with the Labour regulations from time to time in regard to payment of wages, wage period deductions from wages, recovery of wages not paid and deductions unauthorisedly made, maintenance of wages book, wage slip, publications of scale of wages and terms of employment, inspection and submission of periodical returns.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=14>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>That the contractor shall submit the proof of having deposited the amount of ESI &amp; EPF contributions towards the persons deployed at CSMCRI in their respective names before submitting the bill for the subsequent month. In case the contractor fails to do so, the amount towards ESI &amp; EPF contribution will be withheld till submission of required documents.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=15>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>The contractor shall take all reasonable precautions to prevent any unlawful riot or disorderly conduct or acts of his employees so deployed and ensure preservation of peace and protection of persons and property of CSMCRI/CSIR.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=16>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>That the contractor shall deploy his persons in such a way that they get weekly rest. The working hours/leave for which the work is taken from them, do not violate relevant provisions of Shops and Establishment Act. The contractor shall in all dealings with the persons in his employment have due regard to all recognized festivals, days of rest and religious or other customs. In the event of the contractor committing a default or breach of any of the provisions of the Labour Laws including the provisions of Contract Labour (Regulation and Abolition) Act, 1970 as amended from time to time or in furnishing any information, or submitting or filling any statement under the provisions of the said regulations and rules which is materially incorrect, he shall without prejudice to any other liability pay to the Director of the Institute a sum as may be claimed by CSMCRI/CSIR.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=17>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>The contractor shall remove all workers deployed by him on termination of the contract or on expiry of the contract from the premises of the Institute and ensure that no such persons shall create any disruption/hindrance/problem of any nature in the Institute either explicitly or implicitly.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=18>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>The security money so deposited shall be liable to be forfeited or appropriated in the event of unsatisfactory performance of the contractor and/or loss/damage if any sustained by the Institute on account of the failure or negligence of the workers deployed by him or in the event of breach of the agreement by the contractor.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=19>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>The security money will be refunded to the contractor within one month of the expiry of the contract only on the satisfactory performance of the contract.</DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=20>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>That the contractor shall keep the CSMCRI/CSIR indemnified against all claims whatsoever in respect of the employees deployed by the contractor. In case any employee of the contractor so deployed enters in dispute of any nature whatsoever, it will be the primary responsibility of the contractor to contest the same. In case CSMCRI/CSIR is made party and is supposed to contest the case, the CSMCRI/CSIR will be reimbursed for the actual expenses incurred towards Counsel fee and other expenses which shall be paid in advance by the contractor to CSMCRI/CSIR on demand. Further, the contractor shall ensure that no financial or any other liability comes on CSMCRI/CSIR in this respect of any nature whatsoever and shall keep CSMCRI/CSIR indemnified in this respect.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=21>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>The contractor shall further keep the CSMCRI/CSIR indemnified against any loss to the CSMCRI/CSIR property and assets. The CSMCRI/CSIR shall have further right to adjust and/or deduct any of the amounts as aforesaid from the payments due to the contractor under this contract.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=22>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>That the contractor shall ensure that the persons so deployed do not allow any property of the CSMCRI/CSIR to be taken out of the premises without a Gate Pass signed by the designated officials of the Institute. As a safeguard against any dishonesty, connivance and/or ulterior motive, the specimen signature of the officials designated and authorized to sign the <st1:place w:st="on"><st1:PlaceName w:st="on">Gate</st1:PlaceName> <st1:PlaceType w:st="on">Pass</st1:PlaceType></st1:place> will be intimated in writing to the contractor along with subsequent changes, if any. The Controller of Administration/Administrative Officer of the Institute shall make suitable arrangement to ensure compliance.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=23>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>That the contractor shall report promptly to the Institute any theft or pilferage that takes place or where any attempt is made to that effect and loss, if any. It shall be the sole responsibility of the contractor to ensure security and safety of all the property and assets, movable and immovable, of the Institute and if there is any loss to the Institute on account of dishonesty, and/or due to any lapse on the part of the contractor or his worker, the contractor shall make good on demand the loss to the Institute.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=24>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>That the contractor shall provide two pairs of Uniform at his own cost to the persons deployed for this work shall include Shirt, Trousers, Leather Belt with Badge, Cap with Badge, Name Tab Bilingual, Black leather shoes, Socks, Lanyard with whistle, Jersey for winter, Rain coat/umbrella for rainy season and loaded torches at all the posts and CSIR shall have no liability whatsoever on this account. The uniform shall be approved by the Director of the Institute.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=25>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>That payment on account of enhancement/escalation charges on account of revision in wages by the appropriate Govt. from time to time shall be payable by the CSMCRI/CSIR to the contractor.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=26>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>That the CSMCRI/CSIR shall reimburse the amount of service tax, if any, paid by the contractor to the authorities on account of the services rendered by him. This reimbursement shall be admissible on production of proof of deposit of the same by the contractor. As regards Bonus, the same will be reimbursed on production of documentary proof submitted by the contractor towards having paid bonus to his workers.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=27>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>In the event of any question, dispute/difference arising under the agreement or in connection herewith (except as to matters the decision of which is specially provided under the agreement) the same shall be referred to the sole arbitration to DGCSIR or his nominee.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=28>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>The award of the arbitrator shall be final and binding on the parties. In the event of such arbitrator to whom the matter is originally referred is being transferred or vacating his office or resigning or refusing to work or neglecting his work or being unable to act for any reason whatsoever, the Director-General, CSIR shall appoint another person to act as arbitrator in place of the out-going arbitrator in accordance with the terms of the agreement and the persons so appointed shall be entitled to proceed with the reference from the stage at which it was left by his predecessor.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=29>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>The Arbitrator may give interim award’s and/or directions, as may be required.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=30>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>Subject to the aforesaid provisions the Arbitrator &amp; Condition Act, 1996 and the rules made hereunder and any modification thereof from time to time being in force shall be deemed to apply to the arbitration proceedings under this clause.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=31>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>During the period of agreement the contract may be terminated by the Director, CSMCRI, <st1:place w:st="on"><st1:City w:st="on">Bhavnagar</st1:City></st1:place> by giving one calendar month’s notice or on payment of one month’s charges in lieu thereof. Also, the contract may extended with mutual consent of both parties beyond the initial period of one year.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=32>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>The contractor shall get the antecedents of his personnel verified through Police channels and the verification reports shall be made available to CSMCRI.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=33>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>The contractor shall execute an agreement on a stamp paper of required value for due performance of the contract immediately on award of work.&nbsp;<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=34>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>If the contractor selected fails to sign the formal agreement immediately or fails to undertake the work on <st1:date w:st="on" Month="3" Day="1" Year="2006">1<SUP>st</SUP> March, 2006</st1:date>, the letter of intent shall be treated as cancelled and EMD made by him shall be forfeited.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=35>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>The contractor shall not charge any amount from the personnel deployed by him towards recruitment fee etc.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=36>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>Local representative shall be available every time whenever shift changes, at the main gate (0600 Hrs., 1400 Hrs. and 2200 Hrs.) and he must be available locally in Bhavnagar at his local office with some contact telephone numbers at all times.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>
<OL style="MARGIN-TOP: 0in" type=1 start=37>
<LI class=MsoNormal style="MARGIN: 0in 0in 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify; mso-list: l0 level1 lfo1; tab-stops: list .5in">
<DIV align=justify>Contractor has to deposit the ESI &amp; EPF contribution locally in <st1:place w:st="on"><st1:City w:st="on">Bhavnagar</st1:City></st1:place> only and he has to ensure that all his employees are given ESI Card &amp; EPF Card immediately.<o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></DIV></LI></OL>

10 MS/09/2006-07 2006-08-01 2006-08-17 13:00:00 Notice inviting tender for sell one Tata Sumo Dlx, 1998 model <FONT size=2>Tata Sumo Dlx, 1998 model, bearing registration No. GJ-4-D2443</FONT> <FONT size=2>
<P align=justify>Persons interested in buying the vehicle may contact Shri H.K.Chudasama/Shri A.A.Padhiyar of Stores Section for obtaining tender documents on payment of Rs.100/- (non-refundable).&nbsp; The last date for issue of tender documents is 5.45 pm on 14<SUP>th</SUP> August 2006.&nbsp; Before tendering their offer, interested persons may visit the Institute and inspect the vehicle.&nbsp; Though the vehicle is off the road at present, by visual inspection of vehicle one can definitely notice the fact that the vehicle was well maintained. Last date for receipt of offer with Earnest Money Deposit (EMD) is 1.00 pm of 17<SUP>th</SUP> August 2006.&nbsp; The offers received will be opened the same day (17/08/2006) at 4.00 p.m.&nbsp; Top three bidders will be drawn and a final decision will be made on or before 24/08/2006.&nbsp; EMD of top three bidders will be released latest by 24<SUP>th</SUP> August 2006. EMD of all other unsuccessful bidders will be refunded on 17/08/2006 itself.<?xml:namespace prefix = o ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office" /><o:p></o:p></P>

<P class=MsoNormal style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align=justify><FONT face="Times New Roman" size=2><SPAN style="FONT-SIZE: 11pt">COSP<o:p></o:p></SPAN></FONT></P></FONT> 2006-08-01 20:14:12
100 10-53(671)/Pur/07-08/ 2008-02-06 2008-03-11 17:00:00 CNC Vertical Machining Center <p>As per Form</p> <p><font size="2">   </font></p>
<ol type="1">
  <li align="justify"><font size="2">The price quoted should be as indicated in Clause (       ) below :</font></li>
</ol>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"><strong>a)      </strong><strong>We prefer quotations on free delivery at CSMCRI Stores at Bhavnagar which includes all components like sales tax, octroi, freight forwarding &amp; delivery charges. </strong></font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">b)      In case you are submitting quotation on F.O.R. dispatching station Please indicate approximate freight forwarding, sales tax, octroi payable by Institute. This information is required to have a fare comparison of rate quoted with quotation of free delivery at CSMCRI.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><strong><font size="2">The Institute requires items immediately. It will be the responsibility of suppliers to ensure safe delivery of item at CSMCRI premises irrespectable of the fact whether the purchase order is on ex-works basis, F.O.R. dispatch section basis or free delivery at CSMCRI basis. Suppliers as their own description &amp; their cost may ensure the material on warehouse to warehouse basis and no separate charges on account of insurance coverage will be paid by the Institute.</font></strong></p>
<ol start="2" type="1">
  <li align="justify"><font size="2">THE RATE OF SALES TAX, CENTRAL EXCISE DUTY etc. should be clearly indicated wherever chargeable. This office is not eligible to issue &quot;C&quot; or &quot;D&quot; Form. However, the concessional rate of Central Sales Tax States like Maharashtra, Delhi, West Bengal, Tamil Nadu etc. is applicable to this Laboratory. Sales Tax Concessional Proforma applicable to R&amp;D Institutions will be provided to avail sales tax concession.</font></li>
  <li align="justify"><font size="2">As per Government of India Notification No. 10/97 Central Excise Dt. 1.3.97. CSMCRI, Bhavnagar is exempted from Payment of Central Excise Duty. You are requested to Quote for Basis price, CED, Sales Tax etc., Separately to enable us to issue required Exemptional Certificate in case the order is placed on you.</font></li>
  <li align="justify"><font size="2">Specific mention should be made whether the delivery will be ex-stock or store will have to be imported or obtained from the works and the time required for delivery after receipt of the order. The DELIVERY TIME WILL HAVE TO BE STRICTLY ADHERED TO IN CASE AN ORDER IS PLACED against your offer.</font></li>
  <li align="justify"><strong><font size="2">In case any or the items mentioned overleaf is on the current rate/DGS&amp;D contract lists, please quote D.G.S. &amp; D. rate, the contract reference and also send a copy of the RATE CONTRACT. In case the items being offered are not on DGS &amp; D Rate Contract please record a certificate to this effect.</font></strong></li>
  <li align="justify"><font size="2">The quotation should be duly signed by an authorized person of the firm. The name and status of the signatory should be clearly to indicated, UNSIGNED QUOTATIONS WILL BE LIABLE FOR REJECTION.</font></li>
  <li align="justify"><font size="2">Each quotation sent by post is to be enclosed in double cover. The outer cover should be SEALED WITH WAX AND SUPERSCRIBED as per subject mentioned above. The outer cover should bear only the address of the office without any indication that there is a quotation within. Quotation delivered personally should be put in the tender box kept in the office of the Administrative Officer, CSMCRI, Gijubhai Badheka Marg, Bhavnagar – 364 002.</font></li>
  <li align="justify"><font size="2">In case of equipment, kindly let us know the list of your prestigious customers to whom you have supplied recently &amp; with their address &amp; telephone/fax contacts particulars.</font></li>
  <li align="justify"><font size="2">Payment for supplies will be made directly to the suppliers by &quot;ACCOUNT PAYEE&quot; cheque on the STATE BANK OF INDIA, Diwanpara Road, Bhavnagar – 364 002 only after receipt of the stores in good condition and accepted by us.</font></li>
  <li align="justify"><font size="2">No Tender containing erasing or alterations which are not attested by the suppliers who signed the quotation, will be considered.</font></li>
  <li align="justify"><font size="2">You shall indicate in the quotation the name of your bankers and permanent income tax Number.</font></li>
  <li align="justify"><font size="2">Tender condition, if any, or otherwise sent alongwith the tender, unless specifically accepted by us shall not be binding on us.</font></li>
  <li align="justify"><font size="2">Quotations are liable to be rejected if any of the above conditions are not complied with.</font></li>
  <li align="justify"><font size="2">Bidders are expected to provide an Earnest Money Deposit (E.M.D.) of Rs.60000=00 by way of Demand Draft / (pay order for local suppliers only) drawn in favour of &quot;The Director, CSMCRI, Bhavnagar&quot; on any nationalized scheduled bank payable at Bhavnagar or by bank guarantee as per Bid Security Proforma attached. This Earnest Money Deposit (EMD) should be submitting along with Technical Bid.</font></li>
  <li align="justify"><font size="2">The Institute requires the items immediately. Please indicate fastest delivery period of items and time required for the installation.</font></li>
  <li align="justify"><font size="2">Quotation should be submitted separately for each item/equipments on &quot;TWO BID SYSTEM&quot; in a sealed cover. On the due date only Technical bids will be opened, Commercial bids will be considered only of those offers, which are found technically suitable &amp; acceptable.</font><font size="2"> </font></li>
  <li align="justify"><font size="2">Technical and Commercial bids should be kept in separate sealed covers and both the sealed covers should be kept again in one more sealed cover; and all the three sealed covers should be duly superscribed indicating enquiry reference and the uppermost sealed cover should have the indication of due date of opening as well. Please do not forget to indicate information on the top of each cover viz. technical bid, commercial bid, enquiry no. etc. to avoid any confusion to tender opening committee at the time of opening of technical bids.</font></li>
  <li align="justify"><font size="2">At the time of the submission of offer the tenderers are required to furnish an undertaking that &quot;The rates quoted are not higher than what they generally offer to other customers / CSIR Labs.</font></li>
</ol>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">19.   The warranty period and free service facilities after expiry of warranty should be clearly indicated. Details of service being offered during Warranty period may be indicated. Quotation of tenderers who offer maximum warranty and give an undertaking that they will provide stand-by item in the event of any defect noticed during the warranty period, will have a bearing on selecting the supplier while short-listing the technical bids. Institute desires to have 3 years warranty. Please also indicate free service you can offer to institute after expiry of warranty period.</font></p>
<ol start="20" type="1">
  <li align="justify"><font size="2">Please ensure that the technical bid should contain detailed specification with make, model number along with required essential / leaflets / photographs / drawings etc. and the following:</font></li>
</ol>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">                                      i.      A brief profile of the company.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">                                    ii.      List of prestigious customers including Government Institutions / Public Sector Undertakings, Autonomous Bodies to whom you have already supplied similar equipments furnishing reference number along with name of contact person with telephone no., fax no. etc. in India with supporting documents like purchase orders [erasing out the rate of supply] including appreciation letters, if any. </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">                                  iii.      <strong>Please separately indicate the references of Purchase Orders executed to our sister CSIR Labs during last 5 years. In case no such order executed please indicate the fact clearly for our records. Providing this information is essential and ensure attaching the same with Technical bid.        </strong></font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">                                   iv.      Proforma Information Sheet duly filled and signed.</font></p>
<p><font size="2">                                     v.      Authorization certificate from the original manufacturers stating that the bidder is an authorized dealer for their quoted items in Gujarat state.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">                                   vi.      Fastest delivery period and time required for installation.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">                                 vii.      Any other relevant documents which may help the Institute in rightly assessing the quality of the product (e.g. ISO certification).</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">                               viii.      Warranty / Performance Guarantee / Free Service particulars etc.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">The commercial bid must contain:</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">                                      i.      Rates for the quoted items for which technical bid is submitted. (Please use same technical bid for indicating rates offered)</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">                                    ii.      Copies of Purchase Orders attached with technical bids with exhibiting rates.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">                                  iii.      Annual Maintenance Contract charges after expiry of warranty / free service period.</font></p>
<p><font size="2">21.   The offers will be liable for rejection in case of the following deficiencies:</font></p>
<p><font size="2">                                      i.       Unsigned quotations and/or quotations not conforming to the terms &amp; conditions described above.</font></p>
<p><font size="2">                                    ii.       Bidders who fail to submit the Proforma information sheet duly filled &amp; signed.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">                                  iii.       If any of the conditions mentioned herein above are not complied with the tender/information form is left unsigned or signed by an unauthorized person.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"><strong><em>22.   </em></strong><strong><em>The successful bidders, at the time of acceptance of the order, are required to execute a Performance Bank Guarantee of 10% of the value of the order, to cover warranty obligations, which should be valid upto 2 months beyond expiry of warranty period. Penalty, equivalent to 1% of the ordered value, will be levied in case the successful.</em></strong></font></p>
<p><font size="2">23.   The Director, CSMCRI, Bhavnagar reserves the right;</font></p>
<p><font size="2">                                      i.      To change/alter the requirements depending on the Institute's requirements.</font></p>
<p><font size="2">                                    ii.      To withdraw the tender at any stage without assigning any reason whatsoever.</font></p>
<p><font size="2">                                  iii.      To relax any of the conditions laid down above in the best interest of the Institute.</font></p>
<p><font size="2">The acceptance of the quotations will rest with the Director, Central Salt &amp; Marine Chemicals Research Institute, Bhavnagar only who reserves the right to accept or reject any or all quotations received, in part or full, and to increase the quantity, without assigning any reason thereof. The Director, CSMCRI, Bhavnagar is not binding to accept the lowest bid and reserves the right to accept any tender without assigning any reason.</font></p>

<p><font size="2">* Tender fee   Non refundable      </font></p>

<p align="justify" height="150"><font size="2">CSMCRI, BHAVNAGAR</font></p> 2008-04-12 15:34:19
106 IMP(41)/07/2008/PB/T-4 2008-05-30 2008-06-24 17:00:00 UV-VIS Spectrophotometer <p align="justify"><font size="2">UV-VIS Spectrophotometer</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><u><font size="2">Specification:</font></u></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Wavelength range                     : 190 – 1100 nm </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Wavelength accuracy                : ±0.5 nm or better</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Wavelength repeatability           : ±0.1 nm or better </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Source                                       : pre-aligned tungsten halogen and deuterium lamp</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Detector                                     : PMT</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Optical System                           : True Double Beam, Double Monochromator</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Lamp interchange wavelength   : user selectable </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Spectral bandwidth                    : 0.1, 0.2, 0.5, 1, 2, 5nm</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Stray light                                   : 0.0003% or better @ 220nm, NaI 10g/L solution</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Measurement modes                 : Transmittance, Absorbance, Reflectance, Energy</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Measurement Range                  : </font><font size="2">Photometric : Absorbance: -4 ~ 5 Abs </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">                                                      Transmittance, reflectance: 0.0 ~ 999.9%</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">                              Recording      : Absorbance: -9.999 ~ 9.999 Abs</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">                                                      Transmittance, reflectance : -999.9 ~ 999.9%</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Photometric accuracy                  : ± 0.002 Abs (0 ~ 0.5 Abs) or better </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">                                                       ± 0.004 Abs (0.5 ~ 1.0 Abs) or better</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">                                                       ± 0.3%T (0~ 0.5 Abs) or better</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Photometric repeatability             : ±0.001 Abs (0~ 0.5 Abs) or better</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">                                                       ±0.002 Abs (0.5 ~ 1.0 Abs) or better</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">                                                       ±0.1%T or better</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Baseline flatness                          : Within ±0.001 Abs or better</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Drift                                              : 0.0004 Abs/h or better after 2 hours of power on</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Power                                           : 220VAC, 50 Hz</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<h5 align="justify">Sampling accessories</h5><p align="justify"><font size="2">Bidders shall provide detailed information and quotation for sample accessories like </font></p>
<ol type="1">
  <li><div align="justify"><font size="2">Quartz cells with 10mm path length and 2mm path length – four pair each</font></div></li>
  <li><div align="justify"><font size="2">Glass cells with 10mm and 2mm path length – 8 pairs</font></div></li>
  <li><div align="justify"><font size="2">disposable cells for UV &amp; Visible range, please quote for various volumes</font></div></li>
  <li><div align="justify"><font size="2">long path length cell with holder: quote for various option</font></div></li>
  <li><div align="justify"><font size="2">Micro cell holder and micro cell, please quote for various volumes</font></div></li>
  <li><div align="justify"><font size="2">Peltier air cooled sample chamber – Automatic/Manual, 6-8 cell holder</font></div></li>
  <li><div align="justify"><font size="2">Diffuse reflectance attachment for solid samples both powder and films</font></div></li>
  <li><div align="justify"><font size="2">Attachment for connecting 800/000 micron fiber optic cable</font></div></li>
  <li><div align="justify"><font size="2">Film holder with fixed and variable angle for reflectance and transmittance studies</font></div></li>
  <li><div align="justify"><font size="2">Fluorescence measurement accessory</font></div></li>
</ol>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Polarizer/Depolarizer</font><font size="2">  </font></p>
<h5 align="justify">Calibration Standards</h5><p align="justify"><font size="2">Bidders shall provide itemized details of standards for the calibration the instrument/accessories with price break-up.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<h5 align="justify">Consumables</h5><p align="justify"><font size="2">Bidders shall provide itemized details of essential consumables for the instrument and accessories with price break-up for smooth operation of the instrument.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<h5 align="justify">Spare Parts</h5><p align="justify"><font size="2">Recommended essential spare parts list with price breakup for both system and accessories.</font><strong><font size="2"> </font></strong></p>
<h5 align="justify">Computer system and software</h5><p align="justify"><font size="2">Computer and software must be the most up to date at the time of delivery of the instrument. Supply should be complete with all required computer and printer hardware including interconnecting cables, any required interfaces, operating system software, applications software and all other components required for creating a complete system (communication cards etc.)</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<h6 align="justify"><font size="2">Computer System and Printer</font></h6><p align="justify"><font size="2">A minimum computer and printer specification shall be as follows:</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Brands: HP/Compaq/IBM/De4ll</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Intel Core 2 Duo E6700 Processor, 965 motherboard, RAM Dual Channel DDR 1GB (2x512 MB), 2x160GB SATA HDD 1.44 MB FDD, Scroll Mouse, Mechanical keyboard, DVD-WR, CD-R 52x24x52, CD-RW – 24x, 2 Serial Port, 1 Parallel Port, Minimum 4 USB Ports, 10/100 Ethernet card with WOL, TFT color monitor 17 inches, graphic card 128 MB, speaker 2.1</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">HP laser printer with duplex mode printing facility with minimum 16ppm, 1200 dpi</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<h6 align="justify"><font size="2">Software</font></h6><p align="justify"><font size="2">Latest Windows based 32 bit software shall support full multitasking, setting of parameters for control (including accessories, if any), acquisition of data, data processing of acquired or archived data, real time display of method and acquired data, calibration, data storage and reporting, method development, time scheduler for instrument, calibration and shutdown, macro programming, export of data in industry standard format, user management, system check, built in safety features.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"><strong>Photometric</strong>: Single and multi-wavelength</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"><strong>Spectrum </strong>: Comparison of multiple section / relative processing, annotations, data normalization, peak / valley detection, point pick area calculation, Derivative calculations up to 4<sup>th</sup> order, arithmetic calculations, interpolations, averaging.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"><strong>Quantization :</strong> Single / Multiple wavelength and spectrum quantization; K-Factor, Single Point and Multi point curves; photometric processing with user defined functions; weight corrections, unknown tables and calibrations curves.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"><strong>Kinetics :</strong> Single / Dual wavelength measurement, simultaneous display of time course data, enzyme table and graphs; Enzyme Kinetics calculation; Michaelis - Menten calculations; event recording etc.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><strong><u><font size="2">Power/Electrical Requirement details</font></u></strong><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Operation on 220 Vac ± 10%,50Hz</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Vendor should specify the total KVA ratings of the complete system with breakups of all accessories. Also quote for UPS of required rating</font></p> <p align="justify"><font size="2">   </font></p>

    <td valign="top" width="87"><p align="justify"><font size="2">Warranty</font></p>

    <td valign="top" width="443"><p align="justify"><font size="2">v  The warranty period and free service facilities after expiry of warranty should be clearly indicated.  Detail of service being offered during Warranty period may be indicated.  Quotation of bidders who offer maximum warranty and give an undertaking that they will provide stand-by item in the event of any defect noticed during the warranty period, will have a bearing while short-listing the technical bids.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">v  The successful bidders, at the time of acceptance of the order, are required to execute a Performance Bank Guarantee of 10% of the value of the order, to cover warranty obligations, which should be valid upto 2 months beyond expiry of warranty period. </font></p>
</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td valign="top" width="87"><p align="justify"><font size="2">Payment</font></p>
</td>
    <td valign="top" width="443"><p align="justify"><font size="2">No request for advance payment will be entertained.  Payment terms will be considered on merit – either by (a) Sight Draft and/or (b) Letter of Credit. </font></p>
</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td valign="top" width="87"><p align="justify"><font size="2">Technical Discussion meeting</font></p>
</td>
    <td valign="top" width="443"><p align="justify"><font size="2">The Institute may arrange for a Technical Discussion meeting of the bidders with experts of the Institute where specifications offered by suppliers will be analyzed and clarifications, if any, sought.  It is essential for the bidders to attend this meeting.</font></p>
</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td valign="top" width="87"><p><font size="2">Most Important</font></p>
</td>
    <td valign="top" width="443"><p><font size="2">v  The offer will be opened in the presence of representatives, if any, of the quoting firms on the due date and time given above. If the due date for opening happens to be a Government Holiday, the offer will be opened on the next working day. Representatives should have the authorization letters duly signed and sealed indicating the purpose of visit i.e. to attend the meeting of tender opening against the enquiry no. as mentioned above.</font></p>
<p><font size="2">v  Please do not send the offer through FAX or e-mail.</font></p>
</td>
  </tr>
</tbody>
</table></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Offers are liable for outright rejection, when instructions as above are not followed. The acceptance of the quotation will rest with the Director, CSMCRI, Bhavnagar, who only reserves the right to accept or reject  the quotation received, in part or full, and to increase or decrease the quantity, without assigning any reasons thereof.  The Director, CSMCRI, Bhavnagar also reserves the right to relax any of the above provisions in the best interest of the Institute.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><strong><u><font size="2">This is only an enquiry and not a purchase order.</font></u></strong><font size="2"> </font></p>

107 IMP(36)/04/2008/PB/T-6 2008-05-30 2008-07-24 17:00:00 High speed laboratory centrifuge with interchangeable rotors <p align="justify"><strong><font size="2">High speed laboratory centrifuge with interchangeable rotors</font></strong></p>
<h3 align="justify"><font size="2">Specification:</font></h3><p align="justify"><font size="2">1.                   Speed range                                         100-15000 rpm or more </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">2.                   Operating temperature                        - 20 to +40<sup>o </sup>C</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">3.                   Timer                                                     90min or more</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">4.                   Digital display </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">5.                   Run-up and run down time should be short -----1 – 2 min</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">6.           Capacity of angular or swing-out rotors- 1.5-2 ml eppendorf, 15 ml tube, 50</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">       Ml tube, 250ml bottle.</font></p> <p align="justify"><font size="2">   </font></p>

<p align="justify"><font size="2">Executive Engineer (civil.)</font>  </p> 2008-06-06 10:34:42
109 IMP(25)/03/2008/PB/T15 2008-06-10 2008-07-16 17:00:00 Automatic Catalyst Characterization System (TPD/R/O and Chemisorption analyzer) <p align="justify"><font size="2"><strong>&quot;Automatic Catalyst Characterization System&quot;</strong> should be high performance analyzer producing research grade analytical measurements for the determination of <strong>Temperature Programmed Desorption/Reduction /Oxidation and Pulse Chemisorption</strong>.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">This analyzer should completely meet all the requirements described in the following technical features (A) and specification requirements (B) along with Software Data Acquisition System, PC, UPS and other accessories. </font><font size="2">  </font></p>
<p align="justify"><strong><font size="2">A:   Technical features</font></strong></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">A .1             Fully Automatic analyzer, performing experiments based on the synopsis pre-programmed as well as manual control by point-click operation with schematic diagram of the instrument, on screen.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">A .2             Transfer zone between sample port and the detector should have negligible condensation to have utmost accuracy of measurements. </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">A .3             Low internal volume (specify volume) which can assure high resolution, fast detector response, and reduces error when calculating gas volumes.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"><strong>A .4             </strong>Highly sensitive linear thermal-conductivity detector (TCD) which can assure the calibration volume remains constant over the full range of peak amplitudes so the area under the peak is directly proportional to the volume of gas reacted.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"><strong>A .5             </strong>Corrosion–resistant detector filaments should be compatible with most destructive gases and reduce the likelihood of filament oxidation.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">A .6             Flow-control: High precision Mass Flow controllers (Make of MFC may be specified) should provide precise and accurate gas control.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"><strong>A .7             </strong>Cooling system connects to exterior gas source and provides quick cooling of the furnace after an analysis, suitable accessories like compressor etc. need to be included so that another experiment may be started without delay.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">A .8             Furnace heats sample efficiently to 1100°C (Ramp rate: 1 to 20 °C/min.) and offers easy access to analysis port.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">A.9               Exhaust gas analysis port should allow sampling of analysis gas after it has passed the TCD for analysis by a MS, Infrared spectroscope or GC.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">  </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"><strong>A .10             </strong>Quartz sample tubes should be heated up to 1100°C and are designed for easy cleaning.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"><strong>A .11            </strong>Vapor generator should allow analysis using vaporized liquids such as pyridine in an inert carrier gas stream.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"><strong>A .12            </strong>External cooler should enable user to start an analysis at sub-ambient temperature.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">A .13             Mass spectrometer port should be located close to the TCD which allows virtually simultaneous detection on both the TCD and the Mass spectrometer.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">A .14             Separate gas inlet should permit sequential experiments such as TPR/TPO cycles.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">A .15             Reactive and condensable gases should be detectable even in small concentrations.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">A .16             Certain identification of unknown gases should be possible.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">A .17             Heating for conditioning of analysis should be available.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">A .18             Heated gas inlet chamber should be available.</font><font size="2">  </font></p>
<p align="justify"><strong><font size="2">B:            Specification requirements</font></strong></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">B .1             <strong>A</strong>pparatus for Temperature programmed Desorption/ Reduction / Oxidation and Pulsed Chemisorption. </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">B .2             Sample charge: 0.1 to 1.0 grams</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">B .3             Temperature range: Room temperature to 1100°C digitally set, 1°C increments. (Option: cooler for under room temperature)</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">B .4             Ramp rates: From 1 up to 20 °C/min.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">B .5             Loop (Analysis) Gas: H<sub>2</sub>, CO<sub>2</sub>, CO, O<sub>2,</sub> , NH<sub>3,</sub> vapors such as Pyridine, water, etc. (pure gas or mixture)</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">B .6             Carrier Gas: He, Ar, and other gases</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">B .7             Preparation gas: H<sub>2</sub>, O<sub>2</sub>, He, Ar and others.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">B .8             Gas flow control: MFC (incorporated in main unit) </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">B .9             Manual control: 0 – 100 ml/minute</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">B .10          Automatic analysis: 10 to 75ml/minute.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">B .11          Inlet port: Four sets for Preparation gas, Carrier gas, and loop (analysis) gas or equivalent.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">B .12          Sample tube type: Fused quartz for use up to 1100°C, accepts powders and pellets.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">B .13          Detector: Gold plated TCD or equivalent.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">B .14          Pulsed chemisorption: Available.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">B .15          Voltage 220-240 Volts, 50/60 Hz, single phase, 15 Amp service</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">B .16          Extended operating supplies kit: should include reference material, O-rings, ferrules, dust mask, gloves, Dewar flaks, thermocouple, sample tubes, frits, septum, and cold trap cover.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">B .17          Computer, Printer, and UPS of required capacity should be compatible with the main equipment and of latest version available. Should be quoted along with the main instrument. </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">B .18          Suitable Two Stage Gas Regulators for all the carrier gases and preparation gases should be quoted along with the main instrument. </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">B .19          Installing the instrument, showing the performance and training the end users on operations and routine maintenance of the instrument should be free of charge. </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"><strong>B .20         </strong>After installation, up-gradated Data Acquisition and Analysis Software, if any developed by the VENDOR should be provided free of charges.<strong>  </strong></font></p>
<p align="justify"><strong><font size="2">C:            Software Data Acquisition System:</font></strong></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">C .1             Qualitative analysis of all gases evolving during thermal analysis </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">C .2             Quantitative analysis with on-line calculation of concentration</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">C .3             Simultaneous data acquisition from a thermal analyzer via Analog input Module (e.g. Temperature, sample weight and differential weight loss)</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">C .4             Convenient data evaluation supported by a spectrum library, statistical and magnifying functions and a cursor.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">C .5             Data exchange with other programs via binary code or ASCII files.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">C .6             Integrated peak editor package that provides peak selection and editing, integration, data smoothing, re-scaling, and overlay capability.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">C .7             Allow to remove peaks that are of no interest and manipulate the scaling and baselines of desired peaks. </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">C .8             Provides for inputs of mass spectrometer data files.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"><strong>C .9             </strong>Manipulation of the TCD and mass spectrometer data is desirable.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">C .10         The reporting feature provides the capability of plotting two externally derived signals and against time of sample temperature output from a mass spectrometer or gas chromatograph.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">C .11         Integrated data reduction and peak editing software enables peak selection and editing, integration and data smoothing.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">C.12          Windows Graphical User Interface provides quick learning and easy operation</font> </p> <p align="justify"><font size="2">   </font></p>
<p align="justify"><table border="1" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0">
<tbody>
  <tr height="62">
    <td height="62" valign="top" width="87"><p><font size="2">Offer from Principal/Indian Agent</font></p>
</td>

The Indian agents who are submitting their bids directly must enclose an authorization from their principals.  As per Government of India regulations, all Indian agents who are representing foreign firms should get themselves established with DGS&amp;D.  Indian agents quoting on behalf of their principals must ensure quoting DGS&amp;D Registration No. in their offer.</font></p>

</td>

<p align="justify"><font size="2">v  F.O.B. Prices (with all Breakup values)</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">v  C.I.F. Mumbai (with all Breakup values &amp; inclusive of insurance from supplier's warehouse to buyer's warehouse at Bhavnagar, Gujarat, India)</font></p>

  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td valign="top" width="87"><p align="justify"><font size="2">Delivery time</font></p>
</td>
    <td valign="top" width="443"><p align="justify"><font size="2">Exact delivery period may please be indicated from the date of the receipt of our purchase order.</font></p>
</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td valign="top" width="87"><p><font size="2">Indian Agents Agency Commission</font></p>
</td>
    <td valign="top" width="443"><p align="justify"><font size="2">v  If you have any agents in India, Please show specifically the amount of commission payable to them. Please note that, the Indian Agents will be paid only in Indian Currency, after receipt of the material in order.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">v  The role-played by Indian Agents in rendering assistance to your customers in India may also be specified.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">v  In case you desire to forward this enquiry to your Indian agent, kindly mark a copy of the forwarding letter to us for our records.</font></p>
</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td valign="top" width="87"><p><font size="2">Country of Origin</font></p>
</td>
    <td valign="top" width="443"><p align="justify"><font size="2">Country from which goods will be finally shipped to us may be indicated</font></p>
</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td valign="top" width="87"><p align="justify"><font size="2">Previous supply</font></p>
</td>
    <td valign="top" width="443"><p align="justify"><font size="2">Name and addresses of some of the Indian Organization to whom you have supplied earlier the material under reference may also be indicated.</font></p>
</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td valign="top" width="87"><p align="justify"><font size="2">Warranty</font></p>
</td>
    <td valign="top" width="443"><p align="justify"><font size="2">v  The warranty period and free service facilities after expiry of warranty should be clearly indicated.  Detail of service being offered during Warranty period may be indicated.  Quotation of bidders who offer maximum warranty and give an undertaking that they will provide stand-by item in the event of any defect noticed during the warranty period, will have a bearing while short-listing the technical bids.</font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">v  The successful bidders, at the time of acceptance of the order, are required to execute a Performance Bank Guarantee of 10% of the value of the order, to cover warranty obligations, which should be valid upto 2 months beyond expiry of warranty period. </font></p>
</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td valign="top" width="87"><p align="justify"><font size="2">Payment</font></p>
</td>
    <td valign="top" width="443"><p align="justify"><font size="2">No request for advance payment will be entertained.  Payment terms will be considered on merit – either by (a) Sight Draft and/or (b) Letter of Credit. </font></p>
</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td valign="top" width="87"><p align="justify"><font size="2">Technical Discussion meeting</font></p>
</td>
    <td valign="top" width="443"><p align="justify"><font size="2">The Institute may arrange for a Technical Discussion meeting of the bidders with experts of the Institute where specifications offered by suppliers will be analyzed and clarifications, if any, sought.  It is essential for the bidders to attend this meeting.</font></p>
</td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td valign="top" width="87"><p><font size="2">Most Important</font></p>
</td>
    <td valign="top" width="443"><p><font size="2">v  The offer will be opened in the presence of representatives, if any, of the quoting firms on the due date and time given above. If the due date for opening happens to be a Government Holiday, the offer will be opened on the next working day. Representatives should have the authorization letters duly signed and sealed indicating the purpose of visit i.e. to attend the meeting of tender opening against the enquiry no. as mentioned above.</font></p>
<p><font size="2">v  Please do not send the offer through FAX or e-mail.</font></p>
</td>
  </tr>
</tbody>
</table></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Offers are liable for outright rejection, when instructions as above are not followed. The acceptance of the quotation will rest with the Director, CSMCRI, Bhavnagar, who only reserves the right to accept or reject  the quotation received, in part or full, and to increase or decrease the quantity, without assigning any reasons thereof.  The Director, CSMCRI, Bhavnagar also reserves the right to relax any of the above provisions in the best interest of the Institute.</font><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><strong><u><font size="2">This is only an enquiry and not a purchase order.</font></u></strong><font size="2"> </font></p>
<p align="justify"><font size="2">Yours faithfully</font><font size="2"> </font></p>

110 53(101) 2008-06-12 2008-07-04 17:00:00 ENLISTMENT OF PARTIES <p align="justify"><font size="2">Casting machine (solution casting of a polysulfone layer on a non-woven polyester fabric) and coating machine (coating of a polyamide layer by in-situ interfacial polymerization on the casted membrane and curing the same) are to be supplied. Machinery may involve computerized web tension control for unwind, intermediate and rewind rolls using load cells, safety chucks, liquid baths with circulation and temperature control, trays, ovens, adjustable casting blade, air-knife, flex spreader rollers, automatic edge guide, light scanner for web etc. and should be explosion proof.</font></p> <p align="justify"><font size="2"><strong><u>ENLISTMENT OF PARTIES</u></strong> </font></p>

0000000001 Office Memorandum 2005-12-09 No. EPABX/2005 telephone facilitiees <div id="Text_Dyanmic">
<P>All the staff members are aware that a new Telephone Exchange has been installed in CSMCRI a couple of months ago. Since then although the system has been working quite satisfactorily, a need has been felt that there should be improved facilities for communicating outside the Institute for official purposes.&nbsp; Director after considering all issues had decided as follows so as to enable staff to make official calls as and when needed.</P>
<P>(1) Private Secretaries of all the Discipline Coordinators have been provided with a phone with STD facility. Staff members working in the discipline can make external calls for official purposes from this phone after making necessary entries in the register kept for this purpose.<br />
(2) Second in command i.e. next to DC in the discipline will also be provided a telephone with STD facility. Staff in the discipline can also call from this phone after following the above procedure<br />
(3) Staff members can also avail the services of Receptionist (Mrs. Meena Mehta) to make any external calls for official purposes. Mrs. Mehta will connect the desired number and then forward the call to the concerned Scientist and she will maintain a register of STD calls made. The caller will be required to sign the Register in token of having made the call.<br />
(4) ISD calls can only be made from Director's office.<br />
(5) In addition to the above local dialing facilities will be provided at select locations, which may be accessed by all staff who need to make official calls.(list enclosed)<br />
The above facilities are being introduced on experimental basis. Their continuance are otherwise will be reviewed after four months depending upon the quantum of expenditure burden on the Institute on account of increased facilities.<br />
<P>(Y.RAMAKRISHNA)</P>
<P>CONTROLLER OF ADMN.</P>
<P>Copy to:</P>
<ul>
<li>1. All Discipline Coordinators/Sectional Heads</li>
<li>2. PS to Director</li>
<li>3. Shri Shobhit Singh Chauhan</li>
<li>4. Receptionist</li>
<li>5. All PS to Discipline Coordinators</li>
<li>6. Notice Boards</li>
</ul>
<P>Annexure B</P>
<P>Local Dialing only</P>
<div>

0000000003 Office Memorandum 2006-08-08 3-2k(3)/admin /2006 Independence Day <div id="Text_Dyanmic">
<p align="center">CENTRAL SALT AND MARINE CHEMICALS RESEARCH INSTITUTE BHAVNAGAR.</p>
<p>No.3-2K(3)/Adm/2006 Date : 7.8.2006</p>
<p align="center"><u>OFFICE MEMORANDUM</u></p>
<p><u>Sub : Flag Hoisting Ceremony on Independence Day.</u></p>
<p align="justify">The Flag Hoisting Ceremony on Independence Day will be held in the Institute on Tuesday, the 15<sup>th</sup> August, 2006 at 8.00 a.m.</p>
<p align="justify">All the staff members are requested to attend the Flag Hoisting Ceremony on 15<sup>th</sup> August, 2006 at 8.00 a.m.</p>
<p align="justify">Section Officer</p>
<p>Copy to :</p>
<p>1.Security in-charge  Kindly make necessary arrangements for Flag Hoisting.</p>
<p>2. Shri K.K.Das, H.O. For making decorations.</p>
<p>3. Dr. P. Paul, Scientist With a request to instruct the concerned staff to </p>
<p>4. Dr. D.B.Shukla, PRO make arrangement for mike, photographer etc.</p>
<p>5. Shri V.C.Zala, Incharge, Conservancy Services.</p>
<p>6. PS to Director.</p>
<p>7. All DCs/Sectional Heads.</p>
<p>8. All Notice Boards.</p>
